story:
Quad.ly is a wireless keychain pendant that makes sharing your music and audio a snap! 

Its innovative design packs four built-in (3.5mm) outlets that give you and your friends independent control of the same audio source. From music to movies, Quad.ly provides unprecedented flexibility, and it works with headphones you already have. But we’re not stopping there! We’re building in more features like group talk capability, wireless music streaming, an integrated LED flashlight and much more!

The keychain pendant above is something I was looking for long time... and could not find on the market. I travel quite extensively with companions (traveling alone is not fun for me) and in many, many occasions wanted to watch the same movie on my iPad with folks sitting at the same row in the airplane. There are some lousy headphones splitters for two, limiting the number of people included and giving bad performance as two pairs of headphones are powered from one amplifier. Also both cables have to be connected to the device making the cables too short... 

I wanted something that could be always with me, ready to be used during the trip, a device that would provide superior quality and user experience.  

Early 2015 - the idea was born, soon followed by first sketches and 'must have' features definition. I have spent countless hours on the design and prototype to make sure the final device - Quad.ly - will fulfill the requirements of the most demanding users.


The Quad.ly can be described in three short sentences:

Be inclusive!  Share moments!  Have fun together! 

You and your friends can now use your favorite headphones that you already have. With Quad.ly you avoid investing into new costly headphones. You can also connect to devices without 3.5mm jack but with Bluetooth.

It is all about sharing moments with loved ones and friends in public space. You can think of countless occasions to enjoy with Quad.ly - when you are using public transportation, when you are at school or university or walk in the park.

The idea was born because of  travel and you can use Quad.ly in airplanes, coaches and buses but also for example to allow your kids at the back seat of your car to watch the same cartoon or movie on one tablet, with cables only between them.

Do you have a TV set equipped with Bluetooth? Now you can watch movies at night together when kids sleep.

Have you ever thought of inviting strangers to listen to your music or watch movies with you in the waiting room or at the airport? That could be lots of fun... :-)

From now on you can play "name that tune" anywhere!

After achieving the "Talk to me!" stretch goal you will be able to have a group talk over the phone in public space without a speakerphone. This feature can be useful also at work when e.g. mentor supervises a mentee speaking to the customer.

One of the most interesting features of Quad.ly is ability to wirelessly stream music to your home audio system via docking station. Just detach your Quad.ly from the keyring, dock it, seat at your couch, play music from your smartphone and enjoy the moment :-) You will be able to do it after "The full option Quad.ly" stretch goal is achieved.

Don't forget about the available colors and flashlight that will be always with you! 


I bet you ask yourself "Why I had to wait for it soooo long ?"  ;-)



Quad.ly is designed in a simplistic and compact way. The number of features available  depends on the stretch goal achieved. Please refer to the "Stretch Goals" section for further reference.


The compact case in form of a keychain pendant allows you to plug up to four standard headphones to color coded outputs. All of the outputs have the same functionalities. 
Quad.ly has 1 switch and 3 buttons:

- The "On/Off/Mode switch" can be set in three positions

  • Middle position -  flashlight. All electronics is turned off.
  • Bluetooth position - normal mode. 
  • USB position - Quad.ly operates as an USB sound-card with four outputs available.
- The '+' is a Volume Up button - it increases volume of indicated output.

- The '−' is a Volume Down button - it decreases volume of indicated output.

- The 'Output Selector' button has several functions: 

  • It turns on the flashlight when switch is in the middle position. 
  • It chooses the output to be controlled or group of outputs when switch is in Bluetooth position.
  • It is used to force the Bluetooth pairing.

- The Bluetooth status LED - blinks blue when Quad.ly works in Bluetooth mode. Blinking frequency depends on a current state.

- The Output indicator LED emits:

  • Green light when green output volume is controlled.  
  • Blue light when blue output volume is controlled. 
  • Yellow light when yellow output volume is controlled.  
  • Red light when red output volume is controlled.  
  • White light when all outputs volumes are controlled at the same time.

Quad.ly comes in two basic colors - white smoke and charcoal. The additional colors will be available after reaching relevant stretch goal.

The Docking station for Quad.ly has two connectors - Micro-USB and 3.5mm jack. After being docked Quad.ly gets automatically charged over the Micro-USB port. 

To detach the cap it is needed to push cap detach button with a fingernail. This will move internal springs and release the cap.



  • Please spread the news about Quad.ly!
  • Let your friends know about it!
  • The more people the better!





            "Simplicity is a virtue."

The above sentence describes the best the approach that lead to final goal.
Starting from the logo with shape of capital letter 'Q' that depicts four separate rings but single waveform of sound reaching those. 

This is the essence of Quad.ly a consumer-grade piece of electronics that allows to share moments with friends and loved ones. Something that enables you to experience a joy of being together in situations that usually forced you to isolate yourself.


1. Bluetooth 

  • The aptx technology for low latency and high quality
  • Ability to pair with multiple devices
  • Headset or headphones profiles

2. Four independent headphones jacks

  • Independent volume control for each jack
  • The Class G, 25mW headphones amplifiers
  • Jack type auto-sensing and signal routing

3. Keychain pendant form

  • Mechanism to easy attach/detach from the key ring
  • Case made of durable ABS plastic material
  • Size -  2.1" (53mm) x 0.71" (18mm) x 0.71" (18mm)

4. Micro-USB socket

  • For charging 
  • USB sound-card mode

5. Docking station

  • Micro-USB and 3.5mm jack plugs
  • Case made of durable ABS plastic material
  • Size - 3.15" (80mm) x 3.15" (80mm) x 0.315" (8mm)

6. Battery

  • Li-Po 180mAh (3.7V) - 5h+ of operation
    • or
  • Li-Po 360mAh (3.7V) - 10h+ of operation

9. Flashlight LED

  • Warm white color 
  • Small light angle 

Prototypes evolution



The idea is going live! Go and pick your Quad.ly. It will be delivered to you by the end of October 2016.



The Quad.ly prototype is fully functional. All the electronics is sorted out and works great. The electronic elements (including chipsets and passive elements) used are designed for mobile applications therefore are very small and consume low power. When it comes to casing and the physical design itself - it has been designed to house all the components needed and to be as small and functional as possible.
The answer to "Whats's left TO DO?" is quite simple ... It is all the stuff related to mass production, including final version of PCB and mold for ABS injection molding, etc. 


There are two main reasons why crowdfunding was chosen. 

Firstly, crowdfunding is in my humble opinion the best tool that can prove Quad.ly is a great idea! 

Secondly, it allows a broad audience to support projects at early stage and get fancy product. Please help out! :-)

Moreover crowdfunding is a great way to determine initial order quantities, product colors and features. In return, as a backer you will receive your Quad.ly at a discounted price!



1. How can I choose color of my Quad.ly?

Initially Quad.ly is available in two colors - Charcoal and Smoke White. After achieving a stretch goal "Bring colors to your life!" Quad.ly will be available in all listed colors. By the end of campaign we will send out via e-mail a form to each contributor in which one of the questions will be about the color.

2. Can I use my Quad.ly in airplanes during the flight?

Most of the airlines allow Wi-Fi transmission during the flight. The Bluetooth radio that Quad.ly is equipped with uses the same radio frequency as Wi-Fi that is 2.4GHz. Moreover Bluetooth technology allows for much lower power to be emitted comparing to Wi-Fi. 

Some of the airlines explicitly state what is allowed when it comes to Bluetooth, e.g. British Airways:

"Bluetooth accessories 

All Bluetooth accessories (for example wireless keyboard, headphones, etc) may only be used during the flight but must remain switched off for taxi, take-off and landing"

Source: http://www.britishairways.com/cms/global/pdfs/handheld-devices-used-onboard_Dec14.pdf

Please consult the airlines that you are going to travel with.

3. What headphones can I use with my Quad.ly?

Quad.ly auto-senses and supports virtually all headphones that are equipped with 3.5mm headphones jack. This includes stereo headphones without a microphone (3-pole plug) and stereo headphones with microphone (4-pole plug) in two available standards - OMTP (L, R, Mic, Gnd) e.g. Nokia, old Samsung - and - CTIA/AHJ (L, R, Gnd, Mic) e.g. Apple, Blackberry, new Samsung, HTC, etc. Also volume of each Quad.ly output can be independently adjusted for different types of headphones. After achieving a "Talk to me!" stretch goal Quad.ly is going to support built in microphones of the above described headphone types.

4. Does Quad.ly have independent headphones amplifiers?

Yes, each output has a dedicated headphones amplifier with independent volume control. Quad.ly uses Class-G 25mW headphones amplifiers designed for mobile applications.

5. What is the battery life of Quad.ly?

The fully charged single battery version is estimated to run 5h+ with four pairs of headphones connected with maximum power. The "Longer, longer, longer..." achievement means that time doubles to 10h+.

6. Can I pair my Quad.ly with more than one device simultaneously?

Yes, your Quad.ly can be simultaneously paired with two devices, e.g. smartphone and tablet. Quad.ly will pick the paired device that actually streams the audio. 

7. What is the color of built-in flashlight?

We have picked the best one -  warm white, similar to daylight! :-)  You'll get it after the "Light up the World!" stretch goal is achieved.


Risks

The anticipated risks are low. The only risk forecasted is a possible slight delay in the starting shipping date due to unforeseeable circumstances that may happen. 

We will make every effort to fulfill the commitments and deliver your Quad.ly on time.
story_txt:
Quad.ly is a wireless keychain pendant that makes sharing your music and audio a snap! 
Its innovative design packs four built-in (3.5mm) outlets that give you and your friends independent control of the same audio source. From music to movies, Quad.ly provides unprecedented flexibility, and it works with headphones you already have. But we’re not stopping there! We’re building in more features like group talk capability, wireless music streaming, an integrated LED flashlight and much more!

The keychain pendant above is something I was looking for long time... and could not find on the market. I travel quite extensively with companions (traveling alone is not fun for me) and in many, many occasions wanted to watch the same movie on my iPad with folks sitting at the same row in the airplane. There are some lousy headphones splitters for two, limiting the number of people included and giving bad performance as two pairs of headphones are powered from one amplifier. Also both cables have to be connected to the device making the cables too short... 

I wanted something that could be always with me, ready to be used during the trip, a device that would provide superior quality and user experience.  
Early 2015 - the idea was born, soon followed by first sketches and 'must have' features definition. I have spent countless hours on the design and prototype to make sure the final device - Quad.ly - will fulfill the requirements of the most demanding users.


The Quad.ly can be described in three short sentences:

Be inclusive!  Share moments!  Have fun together! 
You and your friends can now use your favorite headphones that you already have. With Quad.ly you avoid investing into new costly headphones. You can also connect to devices without 3.5mm jack but with Bluetooth.
It is all about sharing moments with loved ones and friends in public space. You can think of countless occasions to enjoy with Quad.ly - when you are using public transportation, when you are at school or university or walk in the park.
The idea was born because of  travel and you can use Quad.ly in airplanes, coaches and buses but also for example to allow your kids at the back seat of your car to watch the same cartoon or movie on one tablet, with cables only between them.
Do you have a TV set equipped with Bluetooth? Now you can watch movies at night together when kids sleep.
Have you ever thought of inviting strangers to listen to your music or watch movies with you in the waiting room or at the airport? That could be lots of fun... :-)
From now on you can play "name that tune" anywhere!
After achieving the "Talk to me!" stretch goal you will be able to have a group talk over the phone in public space without a speakerphone. This feature can be useful also at work when e.g. mentor supervises a mentee speaking to the customer.
One of the most interesting features of Quad.ly is ability to wirelessly stream music to your home audio system via docking station. Just detach your Quad.ly from the keyring, dock it, seat at your couch, play music from your smartphone and enjoy the moment :-) You will be able to do it after "The full option Quad.ly" stretch goal is achieved.
Don't forget about the available colors and flashlight that will be always with you! 



I bet you ask yourself "Why I had to wait for it soooo long ?"  ;-)




Quad.ly is designed in a simplistic and compact way. The number of features available  depends on the stretch goal achieved. Please refer to the "Stretch Goals" section for further reference.




The compact case in form of a keychain pendant allows you to plug up to four standard headphones to color coded outputs. All of the outputs have the same functionalities. 
Quad.ly has 1 switch and 3 buttons:

- The "On/Off/Mode switch" can be set in three positions

Middle position -  flashlight. All electronics is turned off.
Bluetooth position - normal mode. 
USB position - Quad.ly operates as an USB sound-card with four outputs available.


- The '+' is a Volume Up button - it increases volume of indicated output.

- The '−' is a Volume Down button - it decreases volume of indicated output.
- The 'Output Selector' button has several functions: 



It turns on the flashlight when switch is in the middle position. 


It chooses the output to be controlled or group of outputs when switch is in Bluetooth position.


It is used to force the Bluetooth pairing.




- The Bluetooth status LED - blinks blue when Quad.ly works in Bluetooth mode. Blinking frequency depends on a current state.
- The Output indicator LED emits:



Green light when green output volume is controlled.  


Blue light when blue output volume is controlled. 


Yellow light when yellow output volume is controlled.  


Red light when red output volume is controlled.  


White light when all outputs volumes are controlled at the same time.


Quad.ly comes in two basic colors - white smoke and charcoal. The additional colors will be available after reaching relevant stretch goal.



The Docking station for Quad.ly has two connectors - Micro-USB and 3.5mm jack. After being docked Quad.ly gets automatically charged over the Micro-USB port. 



To detach the cap it is needed to push cap detach button with a fingernail. This will move internal springs and release the cap.








Please spread the news about Quad.ly!



Let your friends know about it!



The more people the better!











            "Simplicity is a virtue."
The above sentence describes the best the approach that lead to final goal.Starting from the logo with shape of capital letter 'Q' that depicts four separate rings but single waveform of sound reaching those. 


This is the essence of Quad.ly a consumer-grade piece of electronics that allows to share moments with friends and loved ones. Something that enables you to experience a joy of being together in situations that usually forced you to isolate yourself.



1. Bluetooth 


The aptx technology for low latency and high quality
Ability to pair with multiple devices

Headset or headphones profiles


2. Four independent headphones jacks



Independent volume control for each jack


The Class G, 25mW headphones amplifiers


Jack type auto-sensing and signal routing


3. Keychain pendant form



Mechanism to easy attach/detach from the key ring


Case made of durable ABS plastic material


Size -  2.1" (53mm) x 0.71" (18mm) x 0.71" (18mm)


4. Micro-USB socket



For charging 


USB sound-card mode


5. Docking station



Micro-USB and 3.5mm jack plugs

Case made of durable ABS plastic material

Size - 3.15" (80mm) x 3.15" (80mm) x 0.315" (8mm)


6. Battery


Li-Po 180mAh (3.7V) - 5h+ of operation
or

Li-Po 360mAh (3.7V) - 10h+ of operation


9. Flashlight LED


Warm white color 

Small light angle 





Prototypes evolution


   




The idea is going live! Go and pick your Quad.ly. It will be delivered to you by the end of October 2016.







The Quad.ly prototype is fully functional. All the electronics is sorted out and works great. The electronic elements (including chipsets and passive elements) used are designed for mobile applications therefore are very small and consume low power. When it comes to casing and the physical design itself - it has been designed to house all the components needed and to be as small and functional as possible.The answer to "Whats's left TO DO?" is quite simple ... It is all the stuff related to mass production, including final version of PCB and mold for ABS injection molding, etc. 




There are two main reasons why crowdfunding was chosen. 
Firstly, crowdfunding is in my humble opinion the best tool that can prove Quad.ly is a great idea! 
Secondly, it allows a broad audience to support projects at early stage and get fancy product. Please help out! :-)
Moreover crowdfunding is a great way to determine initial order quantities, product colors and features. In return, as a backer you will receive your Quad.ly at a discounted price!

 





1. How can I choose color of my Quad.ly?
Initially Quad.ly is available in two colors - Charcoal and Smoke White. After achieving a stretch goal "Bring colors to your life!" Quad.ly will be available in all listed colors. By the end of campaign we will send out via e-mail a form to each contributor in which one of the questions will be about the color.
2. Can I use my Quad.ly in airplanes during the flight?
Most of the airlines allow Wi-Fi transmission during the flight. The Bluetooth radio that Quad.ly is equipped with uses the same radio frequency as Wi-Fi that is 2.4GHz. Moreover Bluetooth technology allows for much lower power to be emitted comparing to Wi-Fi. 
Some of the airlines explicitly state what is allowed when it comes to Bluetooth, e.g. British Airways:
"Bluetooth accessories 
All Bluetooth accessories (for example wireless keyboard, headphones, etc) may only be used
during the flight but must remain switched off for taxi, take-off and landing"
Source: http://www.britishairways.com/cms/global/pdfs/handheld-devices-used-onboard_Dec14.pdf
Please consult the airlines that you are going to travel with.
3. What headphones can I use with my Quad.ly?
Quad.ly auto-senses and supports virtually all headphones that are equipped with 3.5mm headphones jack. This includes stereo headphones without a microphone (3-pole plug) and stereo headphones with microphone (4-pole plug) in two available standards - OMTP (L, R, Mic, Gnd) e.g. Nokia, old Samsung - and - CTIA/AHJ (L, R, Gnd, Mic) e.g. Apple, Blackberry, new Samsung, HTC, etc. Also volume of each Quad.ly output can be independently adjusted for different types of headphones. After achieving a "Talk to me!" stretch goal Quad.ly is going to support built in microphones of the above described headphone types.
4. Does Quad.ly have independent headphones amplifiers?
Yes, each output has a dedicated headphones amplifier with independent volume control. Quad.ly uses Class-G 25mW headphones amplifiers designed for mobile applications.
5. What is the battery life of Quad.ly?
The fully charged single battery version is estimated to run 5h+ with four pairs of headphones connected with maximum power. The "Longer, longer, longer..." achievement means that time doubles to 10h+.
6. Can I pair my Quad.ly with more than one device simultaneously?
Yes, your Quad.ly can be simultaneously paired with two devices, e.g. smartphone and tablet. Quad.ly will pick the paired device that actually streams the audio. 
7. What is the color of built-in flashlight?
We have picked the best one -  warm white, similar to daylight! :-)  You'll get it after the "Light up the World!" stretch goal is achieved.

Risks
The anticipated risks are low. The only risk forecasted is a possible slight delay in the starting shipping date due to unforeseeable circumstances that may happen. 
We will make every effort to fulfill the commitments and deliver your Quad.ly on time.

story:
PYOUR® Audio - Rediscover your music!

PYOUR Audio is all about music. Music is emotion. And emotion is at the core of our being. Your ears are the receptors of the emotion in music. As you grow past your twenties, your ears may perform not as well as they used to. Your hearing ability simply does change over time and music will start to sound different. This process may have taken place so slowly that you’ve never really noticed it. Until it hits you that you’ve not been listening to your favorite tunes for a while…
 

How your hearing affects your music experience

When you suffer from a change in your hearing ability, whether through hearing damage or age, your perception of sound changes. You may not have realized it, but from your perspective:

  • It’s as if you’ve been listening to a bad mix
  • Or as if you’ve been listening to a poor music player device
  • In any way: music doesn’t trigger your emotion, it doesn’t reach your soul.

You may not be ready to accept that your hearing may have changed over the years. Face it, live concerts (even acoustic!), music festivals, headphone use, music cafés, any other loud sounds and last but not least: time has had an effect on your hearing. Whether you realize it or not. Not sure?
Ask yourself: When was the last time music really moved you? Are you listening to music less often than you used to? Do songs sounds differently, maybe flatter as you remembered them? Be ready to find out what real personal sound can do for you.
 

So what is PYOUR Audio then?

Check out this video where Aernout Arends of Absolute Audio Labs explains the history, conception and features of PYOUR Audio.

 

PYOUR Audio is basically a set of really smart headphones. The hardware is manufactured by Parrot (Zik 3). But it contains a special firmware that lets you do all kinds of cool things that you've not been able to do with any headphone before.  It adapts the sound to your hearing ability, so you will hear music as it is meant to sound. Regardless of how well you can still hear. Just test your hearing via a simple but super accurate hearing test and the app will then calculate the best sound setting for you and program it into the headphones. You will not believe the detail of music that you can hear! Start rediscovering your music!

But that's not all. You can read out the sound level that you are exposing your ears to. And have the headphones limit this sound exposure. In volume, but you can also limit exposure in time. This feature will help you protect your hearing against noise induced hearing loss.
You can also amend the frequency response of the headphones to your personal preference and taste. And set a compensation for balance and mono sound. Inside the headphones.


Further, the standard features of the Parrot Zik3 are offered as well: Noise cancellation, street mode, wireless charge, wireless streaming, presence sensor, flight mode, text to speech to announce the name of an incoming call,  noise cancelling setting during calls, volume and track control from the touchpad on the headphones etc.
PYOUR Audio is the most versatile and personal, and therefore the best sounding headphone for you that you will find in the market. Especially if your ears have suffered a bit over the years. Or if you actively want to guard your ears against noise induced hearing loss through the use of headphones.

 

 

The founder of Absolute Audio Labs: Aernout Arends

The company Absolute Audio Labs was founded in 2016 by Dutchman Aernout Arends. He holds degrees in Product Engineering and in Marketing. He spent his career in product design, sales and after sales positions within a number of renowned brands in consumer electronics. Next to his professional career, Aernout has been touring as a drummer with a rock band for over a decade. He has been playing small and large venues and festivals in Europe and the USA. He also spent much time in recording studios for recording and co-production of his band’s work.The sustained exposure to high sound volumes on stage and at hundreds of live concerts and festivals have damaged Aernout’s hearing. He suffered from an increasing difficulty in understanding people in noisy environments and from light tinnitus. In order to restore normal hearing ability in conversations he had hearing aids fitted. But he observed that he was spending less time enjoying music as it didn’t reach his emotions like it used to. As a musician in need he started researching the root cause and went out to test available products in the market.

 

PYOUR Audio is just the start

PYOUR Audio is the start of a journey. We set off to create a world where everyone can fully experience the emotion of music. And we won't rest until this is fully achieved. And YOU can help us achieve this!
 

Where we are now

We have finished the prototype of the ZIK3 with custom firmware. We have completed and are testing a Beta version of the PYOUR Audio app on both iOS and Android.

We have calibrated the setup for production with the University Medical Center of the city of Utrecht.
By backing this project you will help us achieve our biggest mile stone: bring PYOUR Audio to production and be one of the first customers in the world to fully enjoy the power of restored music experience. Rediscover your music!

In addition to an incredible low price, you will get a unique coffee mug to show off that you are a pioneer in sound experience and that you value your ears.
 

Other ways you can help

Even if you can't back us now, that doesn't mean you can't help:

You surely know someone who just loves music? A friend. Your next door neighbor, Your uncle or cousin. If this person isn't a teen anymore, fair chance that he or she has hearing loss of some kind. Help them discover PYOUR Audio and they will be grateful to you for life!

And remember: you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Pick your color & pattern of the headphones:

Choose out of 4 cool variants:

Black - leather grain

Black - crocodile

Black - overstitched

Brown - crocodile.

 

Frequently asked questions:

  • Do I get warranty on my PYOUR Audio pack?
    Yes, for your purchase through Indiegogo we provide 12 months limited warranty.

  • Do you accept returns?
    Unfortunately, products purchased on Indiegogo are not eligible to returns. If you experience difficulties with your headphones, we will repair or replace the headphones under the 12 months limited warranty policy as provided in box.

  • Can I use any smartphone to operate the PYOUR Audio app?
    The PYOUR Audio app will run on any smartphone with Android 4.1 or higher or iOS 9 or higher.

story:
With the Fluxamasynth  you can:

  • Make your own MIDI instrument with unconventional analog sensors
  • Create algorithmic compositions and put them in a box
  • Use it in a homebrew pinball machine to generate music and sound effects
  • Build an unusual percussion device
  • Make a space age Karaoke machine
  • Augment an analog instrument with a Fluxamasynth-based hyperinstrument

This campaign is to produce 3 new variants to the original Fluxamasynth. These three variations also represent the fourth iteration over 8 years and we've gotten the design down to something that is very clean sounding but still affordable. The new variants are:

Fluxamasynth 32 (upper left), Fluxamasynth Pi (upper right), Fluxamasynth for Adafruit's Feather (bottom, two variations of pin headers and screw terminals).

Here are a couple of examples of projects made with the Fluxamasynth. The first is a musical appliance called Soundboxen #6 that plays back 6 out-of-phase loops and is controlled by 6 potentiometers:

Here's another example where the output of the Fluxamasynth is pumped into an FM transmitter module to make a generative music radio station in a box:

The original Fluxamasynth is in the Arduino Uno form factor and is available in the Modern Device shop (https://moderndevice.com/fluxamasynth). With the new variations you can pick your platform: the Fluxamasynth 32 has a beefy ESP32 microcontroller on board (with Wifi, Bluetooth, and other peripherals); the Feather version is a daughterboard or shield for the inexpensive Feather platform (with Atmega or ARM options); the Pi version fits a $10 Raspberry Pi Zero.

Each Fluxamasynth has a built-in wavetable with 128 general MIDI sounds and an additional set of 128 variations as well as dozens of percussion sounds. It can play music in 64-voice polyphony without effects or 38 voices with effects. Here are some additional features:

  • 14 bits of pitch bend range
  • Access to fine and coarse tuning in cents
  • Access to low level wavetable parameters
  • Stereo line level output
  • Master volume and per-channel volume control
  • 4-band Equalizer
  • Chorus, flange, delay effects
  • 8 Reverb effects
  • Spatial effects

The Fluxamasynth is based on the SAM2695 chip from Dream Sound Synthesis. For all the gory details see the datasheet at Dream.

Fluxamasynth 32

All of the other modules require some sort of Arduino or Raspberry Pi to act as the control module. The Fluxamasynth 32 has a nice ESP32 microcontroller baked right on board so it is an all-in-one solution. The ESP32 can be programmed using the Arduino IDE and has Wifi and Bluetooth capabilities, so these nodes can talk to each other over the network. You'll also need a USB BUB or FTDI cable for programming; if you don't have one there's a bundle in the perks section.

Fluxamasynth for Raspberry Pi

The Fluxamasynth Pi fits the Raspberry Pi Zero and can be programmed using Python or a simple IDE based on Google's Blockly Scratch-like interface. Great for music making in the classroom.

Fluxamasynth for Adafruit Feather

This Fluxamasynth variation fits the footprint of Adafruit's Feather platform, which offers a consistent interface that's an affordable alternative to other boards. You can choose male or female headers, and screw terminals are available from Modern Device.

The Feather platform has several options for microcontrollers; there are versions with an Atmega32u, ESP32, or ARM M0 processor. This works out of the box with all three of these variants of Feather. Some Feather boards also have Bluetooth or RFM69 or LoRa radios. For many of the Feather boards you'll want female headers and place the Fluxamasynth on the bottom since you'll need access to some of the buttons and LEDs on top of the Feather controller.

Fluxamasynth for Feather (with optional screw terminals, left) and the same board with an Adafruit Feather M0 on top.

Programming the Fluxamasynth

The SAM2695 chip that does all the work is hooked up to the serial transmit (TX) line  of the microcontroller; making music is as easy as sending a set of MIDI-formatted bytes to the chip. We've made a Fluxamasynth Arduino library to make this easy. 

Here's a very simple example using the library:

I

Here's a more complex example of a 40 minute algorithmic composition that comes bundled with the library: Terry Riley's "In C" for Arduino.

The Fluxamasynth Book

One of the goals of this campaign is to collect all of the library documentation into one large reference, the Fluxamasynth Book. The book will cover software and hardware, and will show how to hook up pots, buttons, sensors, and alternative input devices. It will also definitively cover the generative music aspects of the library, which can be used to create algorithmic musical appliances.

Design Files and Code

All of the design files are open source, released under a CERN Open Hardware license and available on Github:

https://github.com/fluxly/Fluxamasynth-Designs

The Fluxamasynth library is released under the MIT open source license and is also on Github.

https://github.com/fluxly/Fluxamasynth

Fluxamasynth and Modern Device

I designed the original Fluxamasynth Arduino shield in 2010 as part of my final project for the Fab Academy, a digital fabrication program we were teaching here at the AS220 community arts center in Providence RI. Later we started making and selling the Fluxamasynth as a product of Modern Device, which is now part of the AS220 Industries, an umbrella program for the AS220 Fab Lab, Media Lab and Printshop. 

I'm personally running this Indiegogo to get development and documentation of these new variations up and running, after which they will be available as products of Modern Device (and hopefully other resellers). In the meantime, the original Fluxamasynth Arduino shield is still available today at moderndevice.com/fluxamasynth.

Fluxamasynth Shield (left). Ed Potokar makes beautiful instruments (right), some of which are powered by the Fluxamasynth.

The Fluxamasynth 32 has a nice ESP32 microcontroller baked right on board so it is an all-in-one solution. The ESP32 can be programmed using the Arduino IDE and has Wifi and Bluetooth capabilities, so these nodes can talk to each other over the network. You'll also need a USB BUB or FTDI cable for programming; if you don't have one there's a bundle in the perks section.Fluxamasynth for Raspberry PiThe Fluxamasynth Pi fits the Raspberry Pi Zero and can be programmed using Python or a simple IDE based on Google's Blockly Scratch-like interface. Great for music making in the classroom.Fluxamasynth for Adafruit FeatherThis Fluxamasynth variation fits the footprint of Adafruit's Feather platform, which offers a consistent interface that's an affordable alternative to other boards. You can choose male or female headers, and screw terminals are available from Modern Device.The Feather platform has several options for microcontrollers; there are versions with an Atmega32u, ESP32, or ARM M0 processor. This works out of the box with all three of these variants of Feather. Some Feather boards also have Bluetooth or RFM69 or LoRa radios. For many of the Feather boards you'll want female headers and place the Fluxamasynth on the bottom since you'll need access to some of the buttons and LEDs on top of the Feather controller.Fluxamasynth for Feather (with optional screw terminals, left) and the same board with an Adafruit Feather M0 on top.Programming the FluxamasynthThe SAM2695 chip that does all the work is hooked up to the serial transmit (TX) line  of the microcontroller; making music is as easy as sending a set of MIDI-formatted bytes to the chip. We've made a Fluxamasynth Arduino library to make this easy. Here's a very simple example using the library:IHere's a more complex example of a 40 minute algorithmic composition that comes bundled with the library: Terry Riley's "In C" for Arduino.The Fluxamasynth BookOne of the goals of this campaign is to collect all of the library documentation into one large reference, the Fluxamasynth Book. The book will cover software and hardware, and will show how to hook up pots, buttons, sensors, and alternative input devices. It will also definitively cover the generative music aspects of the library, which can be used to create algorithmic musical appliances.Design Files and CodeAll of the design files are open source, released under a CERN Open Hardware license and available on Github:https://github.com/fluxly/Fluxamasynth-DesignsThe Fluxamasynth library is released under the MIT open source license and is also on Github.https://github.com/fluxly/FluxamasynthFluxamasynth and Modern DeviceI designed the original Fluxamasynth Arduino shield in 2010 as part of my final project for the Fab Academy, a digital fabrication program we were teaching here at the AS220 community arts center in Providence RI. Later we started making and selling the Fluxamasynth as a product of Modern Device, which is now part of the AS220 Industries, an umbrella program for the AS220 Fab Lab, Media Lab and Printshop. I'm personally running this Indiegogo to get development and documentation of these new variations up and running, after which they will be available as products of Modern Device (and hopefully other resellers). In the meantime, the original Fluxamasynth Arduino shield is still available today at moderndevice.com/fluxamasynth.Fluxamasynth Shield (left). Ed Potokar makes beautiful instruments (right), some of which are powered by the Fluxamasynth.

story:
How many time have you faced the uncomfortable situation when someone close to you is crouching loudly nachos and popcorns during your movie?

With one result: your movie is ruined.

 

I am a cinema lover and a sound enthusiast.

Finally, he’s found out a solution to this problem.

 

The ShhhHelmet is the first helmet designed to cancel the crunchy noises in the movie theatre.

Built in synthetic resin, it’s very resistant. The helmet has a cavity that allows the subject to gently insert his hand with a fistful of popcorns in it.

All the crunchy noise will be canceled.

A very sensitive mic will record all the sounds around you while special speakers channel them into the helmet giving you an incredible Dolby Surround experience.

 

No more crunches, no more spoiled movies.

story:
True analog sound, the way it is supposed to be

This hand built tube amplifier will look amazing and sound unbelievable in your office or home. The 3/4" thick walnut and cherry enclosures are hand rubbed with linseed oil, then waxed. Reminiscent of audio equipment built 50 years ago by a craftsman, the retro feel of the exposed tubes distinguish a tube amplifier from any other type of audio player. When the lights are turned down, the tubes themselves produce a warm glow that makes this sound system stand out from all the rest. This is a system you will be proud to display and could well be in your family for generations.


All BlueTube Amplifiers are hand built here in Franklin, Indiana using a proven circuit design and all natural materials.  Each unit is individually numbered and built to the highest standards.

Ben and Adam have spent many hours perfecting this design and making it a truly one of a kind unit.

We could go on and on about the design process but I think some pictures will tell the story much better:

Each unit is hand waxed and buffed to perfection

I think we did it right!

Brothers, Ben and Adam, started Blue Tube Audio about a year and a half ago and have had great success.  After our last campaign we had many people request a unit that could handle 110V or the international standard 220 volts. It's for this reason we wanted to introduce the BT-6 Amplifier.

This new unit will work in the US and Canada as well as the rest of the world.

Want to know you can trust us?

This is our third crowd-funding project we are introducing.  Our first project was the ClockOS project. We were able to deliver all rewards in a timely fashion and have continued to sell these unique clocks to individuals after the Kickstarter program.  Our second project was the BT-4 BlueTube Amplifier and we had outstanding feedback on that unit.  Another great thing about our project is that everything is proudly made and hand-crafted right here in the USA. No offshore assembly or construction on our BlueTube amps. 

Also you can call us and talk to us if you want 1-317-738-4474

What We Need & What You Get

Why Crowd-funding again?

  • We need to raise enough money to make orders for all the sheet metal, milled parts, electronics, printed circuit boards, etc.
  • We need to purchase new commercial grade tools to increase production.
  • We have the location of a new larger shop but it needs new environmental control equipment before we can move in.


Our Spotify Rewards Playlist, enjoy!




  1. Power Switch - ON/OFF Positions. Blue LED ring indicates power is on. 
  2. Volume Knob - Controls volume level, turn clockwise to turn the volume up, reverse direction to reduce the volume.
  3. Input Selector Knob - Selects which input you want the amp to output. Aux 1 and 2 are on the back of the amp. The third symbol is for Bluetooth®. 
  4. Auto-switching Headphone Output Jack - 1/4” headphone jack. When headphones are plugged in, amp automatically turns speaker outputs off and redirects output to headphones.

  1. Sub-woofer Output
  2. Aux 1 input
  3. Aux 2 input
  4. USB Charger
  5. Right Speaker Output
  6. Left Speaker Output
  7. 115V/230V voltage selector
  8. IEC Power connector/fuse
  9. Cooling vents - DO NOT BLOCK

It's not an amp, it's a living sculpted art that sings!

"I just took delivery of my BT6 with speakers and subwoofers. Although still need to be 'cooked' but the sound is very promising. The craftsmanship is outstanding. I would consider even buying a second set for my other home. It's so beautifully crafted that I nice fountain pen would be more expensive than this. This will immediately transform any living room or study into a contemporary art gallery and will become the centre piece of attention the minute you enter the room. It has lasting values and the fact that it sounds so good is just icing on the cake. The touch and smell of solid wood plus the natural wood grain pattern ensures no two amps or speakers are ever the same in this world. Every single piece is unique and there's only one in the world that looks like it, that's your's. it's an instant classic and the ultimate limited edition. Truly a world class product that would brighten anyone's musical life. I use the iPad to watch concerts of my favorite singers in my study and its sounds just like you a having a private concert, how good is that?! Totally recommended. If you were wondering if it is as good as it looks - I can tell you now, it's not. It's far far better!"

Kevin
2014-06-04

Proud new owner!

"This is quite simply the finest audio equipment i have ever bought. The sound is sensational and it looks awesome in my library."

Dermott M.
2014-02-06

Blue tube amp

"Bought this amp, it is really nice looking and works with any decor you put it in. I don't care if you have a modern, colonial, or rustic decor vibe, this amp looks great where ever it is. Personally I can't tell the difference between a tube amp and transistor amp…..if you can, great, if not, then this sounds fantastic all the same. Buy it for looks and hand it down to your grandchildren."

John H.
2014-04-18

A piece of art

"I bought the speakers and sub-woofer with my amp, the sound is very rich. The sub-woofer adds wonderful depth. It's so nice to finally hear all the sounds and instruments in songs I've listened to for years (a big step up from my Bose SoundWave radio). I'm re-discovering my old music again! Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the lack of AM/FM tuner. I knew in advance it didn't have one, but it would have been nice. (Internet radio and bluetooth connection are an easy work around). Lots of ohs and awes from people who see it in my living room, still more once they hear it."

Simon B.
2014-02-25

Exactly what I wanted - beautiful in every way.
"I wanted a small system with distinctive looks and a rich sound, and I couldn't be more pleased. The wood is warm and timeless, and in addition to sounding great, the tubes start a conversation with anyone who visits. The speakers are clear and warm, and the subwoofer is tight and musical without being muddy. I use a media streamer as source, but the blue tooth has been useful when a friend wants me to hear something new on their phone. Was it worth the money? I use it every day and every day it makes me happy. Yes, it was worth the money. Thanks for a great addition to my home!"
Bruce S.
2014-02-02 

Fantastic!!!
“Took a while to get here (international shipping, clearing customs, etc, etc), but couldn't be happier!! Absolutely gorgeous, the sound is fantastic. Can see myself coming back to you for the subwoofer once I move into more space. Thank you for taking the time and effort to produce something beautiful! I love it!!”
Chris M.
2014-14-22

Amplifier Specifications

  • Input impedance  -  100k ohms
  • Output impedance -  8 ohms
  • Output power -  8 watts per channel
  • Circuit -  Class A - Push Pull
  • Frequency response -  20 to 20,000 Hz
  • Total harmonic distortion -  @1 Watt <1%
  • # of Tubes -  6
  • Voltage -  115-230V/50-60Hz
  • Tubes -  4x6005W (Pentode), 2x5670W(Triode)
  • Min input for full output -  .5V

Dimensions

W x H x D - 12.5" x 5.5" x 6" (317.5mm x 139.7mm x 152.4mm) 
Weight  -  14lb (6.36kg)

Speaker Specifications

  • 25 watt 
  • Voice Coil 1" 
  • Znom 8 ohm
  • Frequency Response 70-20,000 Hz
  • Diameter 4"
  • Titanimum cone
  • SPL 87db 1W/1m

Dimensions

W x H x D - 7" x 7" x 6" (177.8mm x 177.8mm x 152.4mm)
Weight - 7lbs (3.18kg)

Subwoofer Specifications

  • Diameter 6.5" 
  • 25 watt Powered Amp
  • User Adjustable Gain
  • User Adjustable Crossover (60-180Hz)
  • Impedance - 4 ohm
  • Speaker Frequency Response 35-800hz
  • Aluminum cone
  • 110V power Only (Not Dual Voltage)

Dimensions

W x H x D - 10" x 10" x 10" (254mm x 254mm x 254mm)
Weight - 14lbs (6.36kg)

BlueTube Audio warrants this product and its parts against defects in materials or workmanship for three years labor and one year parts from the original ship date. During this period, BlueTube Audio will repair or replace defective parts with new or reconditioned parts at BlueTube Audio’s option, without charge to you.

See our full warranty policy here

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please help spread the word about our project.
  • Submit our project to your favorite websites and blogs.
  • Don't forget to use the share tools at the top of the page.
  • Like us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/BlueTubeAudio

Email media@bluetubeaudio.com for more information.

Download our BlueTube Audio press kit here.

Shipping Cost:

Free US Shipping

For international see below

T-Shirt - Add $10

Speakers or Sub only - Add $40

Amp only - Add $100

Amp and Speakers only - Add $150

Amp, Speakers and Subwoofer - Add $200

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Your donation can help us build stronger ties, establish lasting cooperation with local organizations, plan inspirational plans for the audience and create unique concert experience. Today's donation helps us make the world closer.
Gift given! If you want me to succeed, this is the treatment you choose. Thank you for helping me in these difficult times.

story:
The ritual of listening

Sleevenote is a unique premium music player that allows you to experience your music collection as a rich art-led experience.

In a dedicated form-factor.

Artwork is presented using the whole screen, creating a focussed experience for the albums you love.

It feels like one album at a time, as well as being all your albums.

 

Digital music should be better

Digital music services give you access to all music ever. They are great for discovery but not so great for an immersive album experience. Add to that you’re most likely listening to music on a multi-use smart device, where it’s competing with other apps, feeds, notifications and so on. 

Album artwork, the original and most authentic presentation of music, has been miniaturised and compromised in the transition to digital. Whether or not you remember the heyday of vinyl or even CD, albums have always come with extra stuff that you've been missing. 

Sleevenote wants to lead the digital album artwork revolution.


 

The device

A retina-standard touch screen for incredible colours and print-like definition. 

Dedicated playback buttons keep the user interface away from the artwork. 

Durable injection moulded case with comfortable rounded edges.

 

 

Bigger than a CD, nearly the size of a 7" record.

 

Works with your music 

As well as being a stand-alone music vault for your owned music (for example WAVs, FLACs or MP3s from Bandcamp), Sleevenote will support music from the major streaming platforms Apple Music and Spotify, with more to be added on demand.


 

Technical specifications

Inside the device is everything needed for a portable standalone music experience.

  • 7.5" diagonal 1:1 retina touch screen
  • Cirrus HQ Digital Audio Converter (DAC) supporting up to 24bit/96k hi-res audio
  • Wolfson ‘Class-W’ headphone amplifier
  • Dedicated music control buttons
  • 250GB storage (3,000+ MP3 albums)
  • All-day battery life
  • Wi-Fi and Bluetooth
  • USB-C power, data and digital audio output (for external DAC)
  • 3.5mm analog audio out
  • Dimensions: h 160mm, w 160mm, d 21mm

During our final design for manufacture stage, specifications may change slightly, as every possible improvement is explored. We will post regular updates during this process.


 

Cost Breakdown

We have thoroughly costed the product with the help from experienced industry professionals. Ensuring each stage runs as smoothly as possible.

We will be working with product and manufacturing experts to refine the design and optimise our manufacturing and assembly process to a very high standard, this is an absolute priority for us.

 

As a new device, here's how the price compares to music players and tablets on the market.

 

Why is our goal so high?

You've probably noticed our goal is much higher than most crowdfunding campaigns. The simple reason for this is that we need to make a minimum order of 1,000 units for our custom high-resolution square screen. This is not an off-the-shelf part, it is the holy grail for the product's existence, and it is also the reason for its premium price. For us it all adds to the excitement and challenge of bringing a truly unique product to life.

We're running an all-or-nothing campaign, meaning if it does get funded, we can definitely deliver this product to our backers.

 

 

Timeline

  

We are committed to delivering your Sleevenote by October 2021 

 

The Sleevenote database

Powering the device is the Sleevenote database, which currently contains over 1,000 interactive back covers and booklet artwork images. Connecting the database to the software is the Sleevenote API, which allows the app to request new artwork when required.

Our online design tool allows designers and fans to upload album art for the releases they love. Once approved, their submitted artwork will automatically show up in the device and apps for everyone to enjoy.

 

The free app

Representing over 6 years of researching and testing interactive album art solutions, those who prefer to "bring their own device" can experience Sleevenote for free on iPad. Currently compatible with Apple Music, and in active development. We are keen for the experience to be as widely available as possible. 

 


 

Who we are

 

Tom Vek

Creator and head of Design

Tom is a recording artist and graphic designer. He launched Sleevenote as an app in 2013. He has given talks, hosted panels and written about his passion for album artwork. As a designer he specialises in branding, user interface and digital products, working on several digital music products. He is a keen industrial design and music tech enthusiast. 

 


Chris Hipgrave

Head of Software Development 

Chris is a software developer with a background in producing interactive experiences. During the past 15 years, he has successfully delivered innovative and engaging solutions for some of the world's leading brands. Chris began working on Sleevenote in 2017 and is developing the online design tool, app and prototype software.

 

External expertise:

Antoni Pakowski

Mechanical Engineering Consultant

Antoni has a background in engineering and design and has worked on innovative products and technology in startups, studios and as a consultant. Having started his career in R&D, he progressed to working on consumer products, bringing his understanding of what it takes to bring a product to market to the Sleevenote team.

 

The team have completed industrial design, CAD design, product manufacture planning, component sourcing, assembly design, BOM costing, prototyping and model-making stages.


 

Advisors

We have actively sought out advice from experienced product manufacturers, certification experts, music industry professionals, record label creatives, record shop owners, graphic designers, musicians, and creators of successful crowdfunded products.

 

Why we can do this

Software is crucial for an all-screen device. With Chris we have an in-house developer focussed solely on making our software efficient, reliable and a pleasure to use. We have experience with music streaming APIs (the tech that allows us to show your Spotify library etc.) as well as building custom Android software. Software development is an extremely valuable and often wildly expensive element of a tech product, and we will offer an unprecedented amount of care and attention here. As a team we are all about the details.

We are committed to achieving the highest standard with our industrial design, we look to companies like Teenage Engineering, Native Instruments, Analogue and others creating incredibly desirable tech hardware, as well as the design principles of the Braun heyday, and other trailblazers like Naoto Fukasawa (famous for Muji products). Our emphasis is on manufacturing feasibility while keeping a modern geometric iconic design, that will be appreciated for many years to come.


 

What supporting boutique tech means

Backing this project means you are taking an incredible part in growing a new company. The price of this first run covers all our costs, meaning we have no external investment, no loans to pay back, no need to monetise our app (we want to keep that free!), our absolute focus on delivering the best product we can. You will be making an investment towards building a great, independent product for digital music culture.


 

What valuing music means

We could be here all day discussing how you can best support artists (hint: as much as possible), but our manifesto is that music feels better when it feels more valuable. By spending money on your equipment, you value your content, this has been the backbone of hi-fi culture for decades. Even with streaming, giving music more attention, and letting artists fully control the experience, makes it more valuable, and can help encourage buying music or supporting the artist in other ways.


 

We'd love to hear from you

Twitter @sleevenote

Instagram @sleevenote

Visit the Sleevenote website


 

Still life photography by Joel Knight

Filming by Kee Ramsorrun

With special thanks to everyone who helped us get so far with the idea we love.

Releases shown are not included with the product. 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Undertaking a thorough industrial design and component sourcing phase has removed a large amount of risk, as we have proven that the device can be made (sourced, assembled, certified and delivered) within a specific price. We have a margin of error factored into our price for any unexpected costs that arise. We are aware of challenges in manufacture, our intention is to hire a seasoned expert in this field to make it as smooth and reliable as possible. We have made decisions and started development on the device software to allow for highest likelihood of playing back all your music, but there may be certain platforms that we'll have to create special relationships with and will endeavour to do so.

 

Environmental commitments

Long-lasting design

Our design and materials will be robust and hard wearing. Building a tech product that focuses on doing one thing well means we are far less at the mercy of the changing content, formatting and other software requirements which typically prematurely ages "smart devices", also known as obsolescence. The fundamental music album format is well established. We believe we are at a tipping point for the APIs we look to use, and will continuously monitor options for future-proofing. Software updates will ensure that the product continues to improve its core functionality. At its most fundamental, Sleevenote will always work as a drag-and-drop music management system, and we will open source any elements that might be better supported that way.

 

Reusability and Recyclability

Our product design allows for parts to be easily replaceable, repairable and upgradable. We look to institutions such as iFixit as the standard-bearers for repairability. We intend to support the replacement of individual components. We will use fully recyclable packaging, made from recycled materials.

 

Sustainable Distribution

We intend to encourage a bring-you-own-power adapter for our USB-based charging. This will reduce package size and weight for transportation.

 

Creating Jobs and Industry Contribution

In growing our company and product offerings we intend to provide local jobs as well as supporting remote working. Our aspiration is that we can provide an eco-system for releasing music with a quality value for music fans, diversifying the cost-based risk of creating physical formats for new artists and labels, encouraging artist-friendly platforms such as Bandcamp, existing alongside exciting physical and personal experiences offered by artists. Sleevenote proposes artist controlled presentation of the music art form, and injection of value to digital music culture.

 

Support music, support artists, value music, value artists.
story_txt:
The ritual of listeningSleevenote is a unique premium music player that allows you to experience your music collection as a rich art-led experience.In a dedicated form-factor.Artwork is presented using the whole screen, creating a focussed experience for the albums you love.It feels like one album at a time, as well as being all your albums. Digital music should be betterDigital music services give you access to all music ever. They are great for discovery but not so great for an immersive album experience. Add to that you’re most likely listening to music on a multi-use smart device, where it’s competing with other apps, feeds, notifications and so on. Album artwork, the original and most authentic presentation of music, has been miniaturised and compromised in the transition to digital. Whether or not you remember the heyday of vinyl or even CD, albums have always come with extra stuff that you've been missing. Sleevenote wants to lead the digital album artwork revolution. The deviceA retina-standard touch screen for incredible colours and print-like definition. Dedicated playback buttons keep the user interface away from the artwork. Durable injection moulded case with comfortable rounded edges.  Bigger than a CD, nearly the size of a 7" record. Works with your music As well as being a stand-alone music vault for your owned music (for example WAVs, FLACs or MP3s from Bandcamp), Sleevenote will support music from the major streaming platforms Apple Music and Spotify, with more to be added on demand. Technical specificationsInside the device is everything needed for a portable standalone music experience.
7.5" diagonal 1:1 retina touch screen
Cirrus HQ Digital Audio Converter (DAC) supporting up to 24bit/96k hi-res audio
Wolfson ‘Class-W’ headphone amplifier
Dedicated music control buttons
250GB storage (3,000+ MP3 albums)
All-day battery life
Wi-Fi and Bluetooth
USB-C power, data and digital audio output (for external DAC)
3.5mm analog audio out
Dimensions: h 160mm, w 160mm, d 21mm
During our final design for manufacture stage, specifications may change slightly, as every possible improvement is explored. We will post regular updates during this process. Cost BreakdownWe have thoroughly costed the product with the help from experienced industry professionals. Ensuring each stage runs as smoothly as possible.We will be working with product and manufacturing experts to refine the design and optimise our manufacturing and assembly process to a very high standard, this is an absolute priority for us. As a new device, here's how the price compares to music players and tablets on the market. Why is our goal so high?You've probably noticed our goal is much higher than most crowdfunding campaigns. The simple reason for this is that we need to make a minimum order of 1,000 units for our custom high-resolution square screen. This is not an off-the-shelf part, it is the holy grail for the product's existence, and it is also the reason for its premium price. For us it all adds to the excitement and challenge of bringing a truly unique product to life.We're running an all-or-nothing campaign, meaning if it does get funded, we can definitely deliver this product to our backers.  Timeline
  We are committed to delivering your Sleevenote by October 2021  The Sleevenote databasePowering the device is the Sleevenote database, which currently contains over 1,000 interactive back covers and booklet artwork images. Connecting the database to the software is the Sleevenote API, which allows the app to request new artwork when required.Our online design tool allows designers and fans to upload album art for the releases they love. Once approved, their submitted artwork will automatically show up in the device and apps for everyone to enjoy. The free appRepresenting over 6 years of researching and testing interactive album art solutions, those who prefer to "bring their own device" can experience Sleevenote for free on iPad. Currently compatible with Apple Music, and in active development. We are keen for the experience to be as widely available as possible.   Who we are Tom VekCreator and head of DesignTom is a recording artist and graphic designer. He launched Sleevenote as an app in 2013. He has given talks, hosted panels and written about his passion for album artwork. As a designer he specialises in branding, user interface and digital products, working on several digital music products. He is a keen industrial design and music tech enthusiast.  Chris HipgraveHead of Software Development Chris is a software developer with a background in producing interactive experiences. During the past 15 years, he has successfully delivered innovative and engaging solutions for some of the world's leading brands. story:
Long Story Short:

The K231 Active Crossover massively boosts the audio quality of your sound system by replacing the function of the passive crossovers in your speakers with high precision & low distortion analog active filters positioned ahead of your amplifier. Moving the frequency splitting function from the high voltage post-amplifier domain to the low voltage line level domain allows the lowest distortion signal to reach the amplifier, and the amplifier to directly control the drivers. The result is a breathtaking increase in audio clarity, definition and warmth, the likes of which most have never heard before.

 

3rd Generation K231 Active Crossover

We've shipped our first couple hundred K231 Active Crossovers! And we've received rave reviews for the boost in sound quality our customers have experienced. Interest in the K231 is growing fast, and we want to ramp up production of our new 3rd generation design in a big way to support the growing market.

 

What's New & Improved in the 3rd Gen K231?

We've had great customer feedback from our initial two generations of the K231 over this past year. But we always want to keep moving forward to improve the sound quality in every way we can. In this past year we've talked to many of our customers, and we've learned much about our customers' priorities. We've distilled all that we've learned into this new 3rd Gen K231 design.

 

The upgrades you'll find in the 3rd Gen K231 include:

We replaced the old 'wall wart' style power supply with a high quality, low noise internal bi-polar analog power supply with a total of 20,000uF of filter cap and Mu-metal transformer shielding. This new power supply gives a massive improvement in the clarity, definition and 'punch' of the low end, as well as improved definition up through the higher registers. And the Mu-metal shielding prevents transformer electrical noise from coupling into the audio path.

Changing to this bi-polar power supply allowed us to make other major improvements to the balanced signal input and output circuitry, which improved the noise rejection ratio by over 20dB.

We've also added improved support for selection of 2-way or 3-way crossover modes. We've replaced the old method with a simple slide switch to easily select the mode. This also fixes an issue where the sub-woofer mixer was not available in 2-way mode.

And lastly, the audio input stage component values have been more finely tuned for the purest and most detailed and natural sound you can imagine.

 

What is it? What does it do? Why do I need it?

The K231 Stereo Active Crossover is a low cost component you can add to your stereo system that will give you a massive boost in sound quality. The K231 significantly improves the audio quality of your sound system by separating the high, mid and low frequency sounds using ultra low noise, high precision analog active filter circuits in place of the passive crossovers inside your speaker cabinets. The result is a transformational improvement in the level of clarity and definition of the sound produced. This is called Active Bi-Amping. You can read all about the K231 specs, features and customer reviews here. And check out the links below for more in-depth information on the many benefits of active bi-amping.

Professional sound studios have used active bi-amping exclusively for over 30 years. But this technology has been very slow to migrate into consumer audio, even at the high end, due to the extremely high cost of currently available electronic active crossovers and the deep entrenchment of the status quo passive systems.

Our goal with the K231 has always been to bring the benefits of high quality analog active bi-amping into the price range that is affordable to average audiophiles. The K231 uses the highest quality audiophile grade components, and has specs that easily match those of the much higher priced electronic crossovers such as Bryston and Marchand, but without the huge price tag. The Bryston 10B starts at about $3000. The Marchand crossovers are also in the $2000-$3000 range. The K231 gives the same performance benefits as these units, but at a fraction of the price.

Several of our customers are professional audio engineers, and they've done head-to-head listening comparisons between the K231 and both the Bryston and Marchand units. All of the reports so far have indicated the K231 matches or even exceeds the clarity and definition of these much higher priced units.

 

Why Are We Launching this Campaign?

Over the past year we have boot-strapped the funding for the production of the K231. But with interest in the new 3rd Gen K231 now growing so rapidly, we cannot continue boot-strapping. We need to launch an Indiegogo to raise the capital to properly fund a large production run.

 

Campaign Perks & Discounts:

Once we're in full production, the K231 will retail for $499. But in our Indiegogo campaign we're offering the K231 at deep discounts as an incentive for backing our campaign. In this campaign you can receive a K231 at a 20%-30% discount. And to get the ball rolling, we're also allowing the first 10 Super Early Bird backers to receive a K231 unit at a 30% discount PLUS free worldwide shipping! And lastly, for dealers, we're offering package deals up to 35% discount.

 

How Would I Integrate the K231 into My Sound System?

The K231 Active Crossover is wired in-line between your preamp's line level signal outputs and your amplifier inputs. And your amplifier outputs drive your woofer, mid-range, and tweeter speaker drivers directly, bypassing your existing passive crossovers.

There are a few implications to this. For active bi-amping, you need one amplifier channel per speaker driver. e.g. If you have 3-way speakers, you would need a total of 6 amplifier channels to power the 3 speaker drivers in each of the left and right channels. Note that the extra cost of the added amp channels is literally the only downside to active bi-amping. It costs a little more, but trust me, the sound quality is well worth it!

Since the K231 inserts in-line between the preamp outputs and amplifier inputs, your system would need to have these connections available for re-wiring. Some integrated amplifiers have the preamp outputs connected to the amp inputs internally, without external jacks connecting them. This type of integrated preamp/amp would not be compatible with the K231. But if your system includes discrete preamp signal output jacks that connect to your amplifier inputs, then this would be compatible with the K231. The K231 is also compatible with any DAC or other audio source such as smart phones or portable audio players.

You will also need to have the capability to bypass the passive crossovers in your speaker cabinets. Many modern speaker systems are already set up to allow active bi-amping by providing individual speaker terminals for the woofer,  and tweeter channels. These two sets of terminals are normally tied together with heavy bus bars. You would only need to remove those bus bars to enable your speakers to be used with the K231. But many of our customers opt to physically remove the passive XO's entirely from their speaker cabinets to get the best possible sound quality. And still others opt to build their own speakers from the ground up! How far you want to go to get the best possible sound really just comes down to your level of DIY skills and your courage!

To install the K231, simply unplug your preamp outputs from your amplifier and plug them into the K231 inputs instead. And plug additional cables from the K231 outputs to your amplifier's input jacks, one set for each of your speaker drivers.

 

Risks & Challenges:

We realize a lot of people are nervous about crowd funding. People have heard the horror stories of campaigns that have been funded, but then never followed through and delivered the rewards. Many campaigns want people to back them at pre-production stages. And sometimes even pre-design stages. These are definitely risky, with way too many variables. But we really believe our campaign is different. We have a mature design, with a hundreds of units in the field, and no unhappy customers that we’re aware of. And the reviews for our latest 3rd gen design are coming in very strong, almost universally enthusiastically positive. We believe our campaign is very low risk. The only risk is if the parts are not available due to back order or some other unforeseen delay. And we’ll move heaven and earth to find the shorted parts or address any delays to make sure that doesn’t happen! If you back our campaign, you can be assured we will do our level best to ship your K231 on schedule.

 

45 Day No-Hassle Return:

And if for some reason you're not happy with your K231, you can return it for a full refund within 45 days, no questions asked.

 

Help Us Bring the 3rd Gen K231 to the Next Level!

We hope you'll support our campaign. We gotta reach our goal within the 30 day window, and it's all or nothing. Please help us spread the word ASAP by re-posting on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or the social media of your choice. And if you're active in an audiophile club or message board, we hope you'll put in a good word for us :)

 

More Info:

  • Preview the K231 Instruction Manual
  • Making the Case for Active Crossovers vs. Passive
  • Benefits of Bi-Amping (Not Quite Magic, But Close)

story:
The Rava Yamana - A USB midi controller specifically made for VST-Synthesizers.

While most midi controllers are either designed in a one for all or mixer specific design, this midi controller is for VST-Synthesizers. It is aimed to allow the user to design sounds with analog-style VST-Synthesizers as close to hardware as possible.

  • DIY-Kit and limited number Ready-to-use devices
  • 60 Knobs!
  • Analog Synth Style Front Panel helps you to build muscle-memory
  • Less screen, more sound
  • USB, class compliant, no drivers for Windows, Linux and Mac
  • Bus powered
  • Configurable via WebInterface - (if needed)
  • Easy to build
  • Based on Open Deck by Shantea Controls (included)

What We Need & What You Get

You get:

  • A DIY Kit with all necessary components
  • Complicated electronics are assembled (Open Deck Controller Board)
  • Step by Step Build Description Videos
  • VST-Synthesizer specific presets for the Rava Yamana downloads via website
  • Support Forum
  • Important: The print on the frontpanel is NOT final yet. The color of the print and caps on the pots will not be dark red, but white.

Whats up to you:

  • 200 Kits/pieces have to be sold to achieve this price. Share, share, share!
  • Soldering rotary encoders, potentiometers and connectors
  • Screwing stuff together, putting on knobs.
  • Sanding and oiling the wooden side pieces.
  • You need solder, a soldering iron and a variety of screw drivers.
  • No warranty, but our and community support on the build.

  •  

The Price

To make one controller costs about 500$. Only at a scale of 200 pieces can we lower the price to about half that. We would love to offer it even cheaper, but it is not possible without significant loss of quality. So many rotary knobs and encoders have their price, as well as the front panel, the circuit board etc. Nevertheless at about 4E per knob of this controller, it is not more expensive than other midi controllers. 

Risks & Challenges

There are only three types of electronic parts for you to solder: Potentiometers, Rotary encoders and connectors. They all fit only in the correct space. Therefore misplacing components is impossible. Unlike with other electronic kits, where multiple parts look nearly the same, but have to go in special places, this kit is as "Lego" as an electronic kit can be.

Nevertheless, if you use force, or are not careful in some situations you can mess pretty much anything up. You need good eyes and common sense. Building electronics is easy IF instructions are followed 100%. There is no 99% in electronics. It works or it doesn't and it is all up to following the instructions to the letter

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this. It's really important for this project and not just an empty word to put behind everything in the internet.

To find 200 people worldwide who want this is certainly possible. I believe there is really no question about that. The only difficulty is to get the information to them. This is really up to all of us. Share and (send per email too :) )
story_txt:
The Rava Yamana - A USB midi controller specifically made for VST-Synthesizers.
While most midi controllers are either designed in a one for all or mixer specific design, this midi controller is for VST-Synthesizers. It is aimed to allow the user to design sounds with analog-style VST-Synthesizers as close to hardware as possible.

DIY-Kit and limited number Ready-to-use devices
60 Knobs!
Analog Synth Style Front Panel helps you to build muscle-memory
Less screen, more sound
USB, class compliant, no drivers for Windows, Linux and Mac
Bus powered
Configurable via WebInterface - (if needed)
Easy to build
Based on Open Deck by Shantea Controls (included)


What We Need & What You Get
You get:

A DIY Kit with all necessary components
Complicated electronics are assembled (Open Deck Controller Board)
Step by Step Build Description Videos
VST-Synthesizer specific presets for the Rava Yamana downloads via website
Support Forum
Important: The print on the frontpanel is NOT final yet. The color of the print and caps on the pots will not be dark red, but white.

Whats up to you:

200 Kits/pieces have to be sold to achieve this price. Share, share, share!
Soldering rotary encoders, potentiometers and connectors
Screwing stuff together, putting on knobs.
Sanding and oiling the wooden side pieces.
You need solder, a soldering iron and a variety of screw drivers.
No warranty, but our and community support on the build.
 


The Price

We would love to offer it even cheaper, but it is not possible without significant loss of quality. So many rotary knobs and encoders have their price, as well as the front panel, the circuit board etc. Nevertheless at about 4E per knob of this controller, it is not more expensive than other midi controllers.
