story:
Jollylook Auto - A modern, vintage-styled fold-out instant film camera, combining a classic design with environmentally friendly materials, a manual development mechanism, automatic shutter, and a flash.

Jollylook Auto Mini Instant Camera

Featured on:

Rewards and shipping cost estimates: 

All shipping will be from made from Ukraine.

The idea:

We are in love with the look of vintage film cameras, and we are passionate about the concept of creating a stylish camera with a steampunk-inspired vintage design, while still being functional so that even an inexperienced user can easily get great results.

Combining classic design, environmentally friendly materials for the camera body, a manual development mechanism and modern functional electronics, we have created a design that we are sure will impress even the most demanding of users.

How does it work?

Insert a Fujifilm Instax mini film cassette:

Set the focus distance using the easy to read focus scale: 

Choose the aperture to creatively achieve the depth of field you desire (f/16, f/22; f/32; f/45; f/64; pinhole) 

Open the viewfinder:

Charge the flash:

Look through the viewfinder:

Take a photo! 

Develop the photo by turning the crank: 

After a few minutes, you will have a unique instant photo in your hands

Jollylook Auto Mini uses Fujifilm “Instax mini” instant film cassettes which are readily available worldwide. 

Jollylook Auto Square uses Fujifilm “Instax Square” instant film cassettes which are readily available worldwide. 

The advantages of Jollylook Auto:

Vintage Design – The classic vintage-inspired design is striking and attracts attention from all who see it.

Automatic - Auto exposure and flash make it easy to shoot and achieve great results.

Precise focus control - Unlike most instant cameras, Jollylook Auto features precise manual focus control for sharper results at all distances.

Foldout and Compact - Little bigger than a smartphone box, the Jollylook Auto fits into a jacket pocket or small bag with ease.

Easy to use – With easy to follow instructions the Jollylook Auto can be used immediately and instantly.

A striking display camera - Even when not in use the Jollylook Auto looks beautiful on the shelf!

Fun to use - Jollylook Auto is a fun and interesting camera to use that teaches you more about photography while impressing your friends and creating amazing instant memories.

Beautiful photos – Using Instax mini film you get 10 instant color or monochrome analog photos. Instax is the most reliable, affordable and long-lasting instant film available. 

Environmentally-friendly – The case of the Jollylook Auto is made from easily recyclable, biodegradable laminated wood fiber material.

The creation of Jollylook Auto: 

We created many designs of the Jollylook Auto camera...

Until we achieved a final design that features a harmonious combination of shape and function that was easy to use, reliable and sturdy while retaining the vintage steampunk aesthetic we desired.

Of course, for every test, we had to build a computer model and program the laser cutting machine, which was brilliantly managed by Artyom, our design and laser cutting specialist.

Finally, we had a large-scale prototype ready.

Then it was time to develop the shutter unit - we decided that automatic exposure with the ability to select your preferred aperture gave the photographer the greatest ability to achieve creative results in all light levels, while still ensuring well-exposed photos and ease of use for beginners.

After the technical solutions and components were chosen and the electronic design was developed, prototypes of printed-circuit boards were manufactured, and the firmware for the flash was developed by our engineering team, comprising Andrey and Alexey.

The second iteration of the board and the fifth iteration of the firmware suited us. We printed prototypes of the body and plastic parts of the shutter unit on a 3D printer.

This process included many changes and improvements, and it was necessary to change the logic of the camera control and status indication and to make subtle design changes to facilitate ease of use and reliability. 

Also at the prototype stage, the problem of material selection was solved. We had originally planned to use lightweight plywood, but the complexity of processing and the need to use lacquers, solvents, and grinding added cost and risk that we chose not to take to ensure a more affordable product and fewer potential delays in manufacture.

The wood-fiber material selected for the Jollylook Auto contains less glue than plywood and does not contain formaldehyde at all, features a surface that does not require additional processing, looks magnificent, and is easily able to be manufactured on our in-house laser cutter. The final finish has been further improved by laser cutting techniques used by Artyom which create a very attractive look to the cuts and enhances the overall appearance of the camera.

The development unit was developed by us for the original cardboard Jollylook camera and has been proven to be a sturdy and reliable unit.

Finally, 14 months after the development of the original concept, we're here looking for your support to bring this amazing and beautiful camera to life!

You will be able to choose from 2 colors in the pledge manager:

Technical parameters of the Jollylook Mini Auto:

  •  Automatic instant camera with manual development unit.
     
  •  Shutter body and aperture constructed from laminated fibreboard.
     
  •  Shutter: electro-mechanical.
     
  •  Viewfinder - Fresnel reduction lens.
     
  •  Lens - Optical quality acrylic meniscus with a focal length of 110mm.
     
  •  Light filter - polarized neutral.
     
  •  Pinhole - a perfectly round hole in a copper foil with a diameter of 0.38 mm - located on the diaphragm plate.
     
  •  Aperture - manual selection for five values: f/16, f/22; f/32; f/45; f/64 + pinhole.
     
  •  Shutter speed - set automatically by a light sensor. 1/200 second to 60 seconds plus Bulb
     
  •  Multiple exposure functionality.
     
  •   A built-in flash unit.
     
  •  Attached polarizing filter.
     
  •  Standard tripod mount.
     
  •  Power supply -Internal lithium-ion battery with charging via micro USB using a standard phone charger (not included).
     
  •  Battery charge life – in excess of 80 images based upon initial testing (Assumes 50% flash use).
     
  •  Film ejection - manual crank drive mechanism.
     
  •  Operating temperature - 10 - 35C in dry weather.
     
  •  Size - 135/95/65 mm or 5.3/3.7/2.55 Inch (when folded).
     
  •  Weight - 420 Grams(g) / 15 oz.
     
  •  Storage conditions - in a dry place out of the direct sun at room temperature.
     

Our Vision:

Our vision is to create exciting, fun to use cameras that feature striking design and offer creative photographic features not included in other affordable instant cameras.

Our first camera, the cardboard constructed Jollylook Instant Camera did exactly that. However, over the course of its development and production, we experienced many issues, from problems with parts delivery from suppliers, material choice and reliability and critically, poor manufacturing quality control by our selected Chinese manufacturing partner.

These issues resulted in us having to invest our personal savings and borrow further funds to continue to meet our obligations to backers. Production was moved from China to Ukraine, and a new manufacturing and assembly facility was created. The design of the Jollylook was improved to enhance reliability and employees were sourced and trained to assemble the new, improved Jollylook. Production of the new Ukrainian made cardboard Jollylook commenced in late January 2019.

We learned significant lessons from the development of the first Jollylook, and have taken all of those lessons and incorporated them into the way we designed the Jollylook Auto. We have identified the best materials, suppliers of key parts, glues, assembly techniques and more, and have extensive experience with all of these materials and suppliers from making the original Jollylook. We are better placed today than at any previous time to bring the Jollylook Auto to fruition successfully, ensuring that these lessons learned at significant cost will assist us to fulfill all our obligations to backers of the Jollylook Auto in a timely manner.

The Jollylook team:

Oleg Khalip - Co-founder and the author of the idea - a designer and inventor with 33 years of experience in the organization and design of production facilities in the field of engineering.

Evgeniy Ivanov – Co-founder and our internet guru, takes care of marketing, PR and social networks.

Ludmila Gordon - General manager who oversees the operations of the factory, relationships with contractors, and shipments.

Elena Duhovenko - Our project manager who takes care of communication and sales.

Ivan Borodin - Head of manufacturing, controls manufacturing processes and equipment.

Artyom Zdanovskiy - Design, assembly, and laser cutting.

Aleksey Koshevoy - Engineer-developer, software, and firmware.

Andrey Baryshok - Engineer, electronics and circuit boards.

Anzhela Zayceva - Packing and Quality control.

story:
Hi Indiegogo! It's good to be back.

Ever since our first project in 2017 we've been working on the next big thing. And we're beyond excited to finally share it with you

We love to travel light. But we also love the creative freedom a tripod offers. Steady shots, long exposures, self timers... This seemingly impossible combination was the spark that gave birth to the Conda strap™. 

 

The Conda strap™ is the love-child between a camera strap and a tripod

In it's loose state the Conda strap™ is flexible like a normal strap, having all the qualities you would expect from a great camera strap ( and more, but let's talk about that later ). When the lever is engaged the strap stiffens, opening up a world of possibilities.

 

There is literally no end to where or how you can use the Conda strap™. Use it in Tripod mode or wrap it around a tree, pole or fence and get steady shots anywhere.

This might just be the Vloggers best friend. The Conda strap™ transforms into the ultimate selfie sticks, video rig or tripod for any surface. Do everything, without having to bring anything.

Switching between different carrying modes with ease is key for a great camera strap. We've integrated a bunch of smart features to ensure that you can hop between neck, sling and shoulder mode in no time.

Adjusting the length is simple and done in no time.

 

The Conda strap™ comes in two different versions, Standard and Plus. The Plus version is recommended for heavier cameras and the Standard version is suitable for lighter cameras such as compacts, mirrorless and lighter DSLR's.

Not only did we set out to create a whole new category of camera equipment. We made damn sure we made the best camera strap. Period.

Three levels of stiffness

The patent pending technology behind the Conda strap™ allows the lever to be operated between three different states. 'Loose' is just what it sounds like, loose like a normal camera strap. The 'Semi' state allows you to manually shape the strap into the desired configuration. And once you got the framing in place, switch the lever to 'Stiff' and the strap locks into position.

 

Separable

The quick release enables you to wrap the Conda strap™ around a pole, tree or whatever you can think of. Simply press the two safety clasps and split the housing in two. Pretty damn cool.

Legendary length adjustment 

Probably the fastest length adjustment you've ever seen. Slide down the locking wedge, slide the strap to the desired length and lock it in place by sliding the locking wedge back into place. Makes it easy to switch between neck or sling style when you're on the go.

Dampened and padded for extreme comfort

The Conda strap™ is dampened which means it smooths out the forces generated from walking with your camera, giving you a more comfy ride. Game changer.

Smooth or grippy

The Smooth side has a low friction surface ideal when using the strap in sling mode and the grippy side keeps the strap in place when hanging the camera over the shoulder.

Tool-less installation

Bye bye, hex keys (In case you haven't lost them already). Should you need to tighten the camera screw more than your fingers can handle, simply use a coin. The Conda Strap™ has a female 1/4-20 thread at the bottom so you can attach it to rigs, extra plates etc.

Relentless engineering

We take safety serious and the Conda strap™ is designed for loads up to 75 kg (165 lbs). We know that cheaping out on materials never pays off. You won't find anything else than stainless steel or anodized 6061 aluminium in the metal components and the housing is made from super strong fiber filled Nylon. The joints are made from a custom manufactured polymer with unique properties that gives the Conda strap™ it's locking power and stiffness.

Adjustable tension

Should you ever need to adjust the holding strength, we got you covered. The tension mechanism is neatly hidden inside the neck strap in case you need it.

Simply twist the end caps if you ever need to adjust the holding power

The Conda strap™ will be available in three different color combinations, Black, Titanium and Ruby. 

Black on Black. The matte logo reflects beautifully in contrast to the dark, shimmering strap.

The Titanium gray is discreet but has a bit more contrast between the dark logo and the sleeve compared to the black version.

The Ruby red is a radiant option featuring a contrasting logo and a dark, red sleeve.

 

The final production version swimming in a sea of it's predecessors

It's been a long journey to get to where we are today. The idea behind the Conda strap™ emerged when we asked some of our customers back in 2017 what problems they faced when they are out shooting. There was one reply in particular that caught our attention,

"I really like my tripod, but I hate bringing my tripod."

The task seemed daunting at first. But after boiling down the problem to the most essential component we had our mission set,

"Allow the user to point the camera in any direction, without bringing anything else than the camera itself."

The strap seemed like the perfect candidate to improve upon and we immediately got to work. 3 years in and more than 175 prototypes later we're happy to say we finally solved the problem.

The most important injection molds and jigs have already been produced in order to minimize risk and confirm the most essential features

Jonas and Hampus Lundin

Frii Designs was founded from the vision of making life easier for photographers. We're based in Stockholm, Sweden and we're an incredibly product focused team that lives and breathes to produce the best possible solutions to the most painful problems.

Frii was founded by Jonas Lundin in 2017, a photographer and mechanical engineer specialized in industrial design from Lund university. Together with his brother Hampus Lundin, a biomedical engineer from Linköping university devoted to automation and production, they form Frii Designs. The siblings practically grew up in the family garage building bikes, 3D-printers and camera equipment and have over the years developed a great sense for design and ability to co-operate.

Inventing things since day 1 (manners were developed later on)

Why Crowdfunding?

We wouldn't exist if it wasn't for Crowdfunding. The day the TriLens™ was funded back in 2017 our company was born. It was an incredibly humbling experience to be trusted with that level of responsibility and we managed to deliver an amazing product to every single one of our backers. The Conda strap project is way past the high risk hurdles and all that's left is placing the order for the mass production tooling, and that's where You come in.

This project wouldn't have been possible without the help from,

Tommy Süld, Isabel Fjelking, Marcus Jigeman, Almi Stockholm & the Anagada crew.

 

Risks and challenges

This is not our first time on Indiegogo. We've learned a lot from our last campaign and we're proud to say that we delivered what we promised to every single one of our backers. Starting a company from the ground up is exciting, but there are a lot of things we're happy that we wont have to do all over again. Finding suppliers, getting an office space, building a workshop, hiring people and setting up all the shipping and IT systems. The basics have already been taken care of so we can focus 100% on delivering the best possible product to our backers. Our new suppliers have delivered the samples on time and in accordance to our specifications. But our experience has taught us that unexpected things can happen. Machines can break down and molds can have to be adjusted. We have taken small hiccups into consideration when creating our production plan but if something major were to happen, things can get delayed. We have backed several crowdfunded projects and we know how important transparency is and how much of an asset the backer updates are. Whatever happens, good or bad, we will disclose the progress to our backers in our updates. Shipping globally is always a large endeavor. There are a lot of things out of our control that can delay the delivery of your rewards. But we've done this daily for the past three years and have learned a lot! Since our last campaign we got a new shipping provider and increased traceability for all of our shipments.

Environmental commitments

Long-lasting design

The Conda strap is easily serviceable, which means that you can adjust it's main functions and increase the life span of the product without the need for any tools. We made a promise to ourselves to never charge the customer for spare parts because we know how costly it is, both monetary and planetary, to ship out replacement parts. By designing the Conda strap to truly last we created a product where everybody wins, including the planet.

Reusability and recyclability

We've been hard at work to minimize the amount of packaging needed and have come up with a great solution that will keep both volume and unnecessary weight to an absolute minimum. Not only will this make a huge impact on transportation emissions but will also make sure that there will be less material ending up on a landfill once the product has been delivered to the customer. Basically we're maximizing the amount of value that is being sent and minimizing any unnecessary packaging material that will be discarded upon arrival anyway.

Sustainable materials

Our main plastics supplier is ISO 9001 certified and we've made sure that all of our injection molded plastics are utilized to 100%. Our suppliers have set up our production lines so that any failed parts, runners and waste are recycled back into the system and made into new parts for the Conda strap.

Environmentally friendly factories

In order to keep transportation and emissions to a minimum we always aspire to keep our suppliers as close as possible. Our key suppliers are just a few kilometres away from our HQ and if we have goods that needs to be transported for longer distances we always opt for train over air when possible.

Sustainable Distribution

For this campaign we've incorporated a new shipping strategy where the packages are sent in bulk from our HQ in Sweden to a distribution center in Germany. This minimize the risk for lost packages and will reduce the emissions generated in the first part of the journey by more than 25%. Our philosophy have always been to accomplish more with less stuff. The Conda strap incorporates a lot of functions that enables the user to replace both the tripod and backpack and makes travelling easier and the luggage a lot lighter.
story_txt: Hi Indiegogo! It's good to be back.Ever since our first project in 2017 we've been working on the next big thing. And we're beyond excited to finally share it with youWe love to travel light. But we also love the creative freedom a tripod offers. Steady shots, long exposures, self timers... This seemingly impossible combination was the spark that gave birth to the Conda strap™.  The Conda strap™ is the love-child between a camera strap and a tripodIn it's loose state the Conda strap™ is flexible like a normal strap, having all the qualities you would expect from a great camera strap ( and more, but let's talk about that later ). When the lever is engaged the strap stiffens, opening up a world of possibilities. There is literally no end to where or how you can use the Conda strap™. Use it in Tripod mode or wrap it around a tree, pole or fence and get steady shots anywhere.This might just be the Vloggers best friend. The Conda strap™ transforms into the ultimate selfie sticks, video rig or tripod for any surface. Do everything, without having to bring anything.Switching between different carrying modes with ease is key for a great camera strap. We've integrated a bunch of smart features to ensure that you can hop between neck, sling and shoulder mode in no time.Adjusting the length is simple and done in no time. The Conda strap™ comes in two different versions, Standard and Plus. The Plus version is recommended for heavier cameras and the Standard version is suitable for lighter cameras such as compacts, mirrorless and lighter DSLR's.Not only did we set out to create a whole new category of camera equipment. We made damn sure we made the best camera strap. Period.Three levels of stiffnessThe patent pending technology behind the Conda strap™ allows the lever to be operated between three different states. 'Loose' is just what it sounds like, loose like a normal camera strap. The 'Semi' state allows you to manually shape the strap into the desired configuration. And once you got the framing in place, switch the lever to 'Stiff' and the strap locks into position. SeparableThe quick release enables you to wrap the Conda strap™ around a pole, tree or whatever you can think of. Simply press the two safety clasps and split the housing in two. Pretty damn cool.Legendary length adjustment Probably the fastest length adjustment you've ever seen. Slide down the locking wedge, slide the strap to the desired length and lock it in place by sliding the locking wedge back into place. Makes it easy to switch between neck or sling style when you're on the go.Dampened and padded for extreme comfortThe Conda strap™ is dampened which means it smooths out the forces generated from walking with your camera, giving you a more comfy ride. Game changer.Smooth or grippyThe Smooth side has a low friction surface ideal when using the strap in sling mode and the grippy side keeps the strap in place when hanging the camera over the shoulder.Tool-less installationBye bye, hex keys (In case you haven't lost them already). Should you need to tighten the camera screw more than your fingers can handle, simply use a coin. The Conda Strap™ has a female 1/4-20 thread at the bottom so you can attach it to rigs, extra plates etc.Relentless engineeringWe take safety serious and the Conda strap™ is designed for loads up to 75 kg (165 lbs). We know that cheaping out on materials never pays off. You won't find anything else than stainless steel or anodized 6061 aluminium in the metal components and the housing is made from super strong fiber filled Nylon. The joints are made from a custom manufactured polymer with unique properties that gives the Conda strap™ it's locking power and stiffness.Adjustable tensionShould you ever need to adjust the holding strength, we got you covered. The tension mechanism is neatly hidden inside the neck strap in case you need it.Simply twist the end caps if you ever need to adjust the holding powerThe Conda strap™ will be available in three different color combinations, Black, Titanium and Ruby. Black on Black. The matte logo reflects beautifully in contrast to the dark, shimmering strap.The Titanium gray is discreet but has a bit more contrast between the dark logo and the sleeve compared to the black version.The Ruby red is a radiant option featuring a contrasting logo and a dark, red sleeve. The final production version swimming in a sea of it's predecessorsIt's been a long journey to get to where we are today. The idea behind the Conda strap™ emerged when we asked some of our customers back in 2017 what problems they faced when they are out shooting. There was one reply in particular that caught our attention,"I really like my tripod, but I hate bringing my tripod."The task seemed daunting at first. But after boiling down the problem to the most essential component we had our mission set,"Allow the user to point the camera in any direction, without bringing anything else than the camera itself."The strap seemed like the perfect candidate to improve upon and we immediately got to work. 3 years in and more than 175 prototypes later we're happy to say we finally solved the problem.The most important injection molds and jigs have already been produced in order to minimize risk and confirm the most essential featuresJonas and Hampus LundinFrii Designs was founded from the vision of making life easier for photographers. We're based in Stockholm, Sweden and we're an incredibly product focused team that lives and breathes to produce the best possible solutions to the most painful problems.Frii was founded by Jonas Lundin in 2017, a photographer and mechanical engineer specialized in industrial design from Lund university. Together with his brother Hampus Lundin, a biomedical engineer from Linköping university devoted to automation and production, they form Frii Designs. The siblings practically grew up in the family garage building bikes, 3D-printers and camera equipment and have over the years developed a great sense for design and ability to co-operate.Inventing things since day 1 (manners were developed later on)Why Crowdfunding?We wouldn't exist if it wasn't for Crowdfunding. The day the TriLens™ was funded back in 2017 our company was born. It was an incredibly humbling experience to be trusted with that level of responsibility and we managed to deliver an amazing product to every single one of our backers. The Conda strap project is way past the high risk hurdles and all that's left is placing the order for the mass production tooling, and that's where You come in.This project wouldn't have been possible without the help from,Tommy Süld, Isabel Fjelking, Marcus Jigeman, Almi Stockholm & the Anagada crew. Risks and challengesThis is not our first time on Indiegogo. We've learned a lot from our last campaign and we're proud to say that we delivered what we promised to every single one of our backers. Starting a company from the ground up is exciting, but there are a lot of things we're happy that we wont have to do all over again. Finding suppliers, getting an office space, building a workshop, hiring people and setting up all the shipping and IT systems. The basics have already been taken care of so we can focus 100% on delivering the best possible product to our backers. Our new suppliers have delivered the samples on time and in accordance to our specifications. But our experience has taught us that unexpected things can happen. Machines can break down and molds can have to be adjusted. We have taken small hiccups into consideration when creating our production plan but if something major were to happen, things can get delayed. We have backed several crowdfunded projects and we know how important transparency is and how much of an asset the backer updates are. Whatever happens, good or bad, we will disclose the progress to our backers in our updates. Shipping globally is always a large endeavor. There are a lot of things out of our control that can delay the delivery of your rewards. But we've done this daily for the past three years and have learned a lot! Since our last campaign we got a new shipping provider and increased traceability for all of our shipments.Environmental commitmentsLong-lasting designThe Conda strap is easily serviceable, which means that you can adjust it's main functions and increase the life span of the product without the need for any tools. We made a promise to ourselves to never charge the customer for spare parts because we know how costly it is, both monetary and planetary, to ship out replacement parts. By designing the Conda strap to truly last we created a product where everybody wins, including the planet.Reusability and recyclabilityWe've been hard at work to minimize the amount of packaging needed and have come up with a great solution that will keep both volume and unnecessary weight to an absolute minimum. Not only will this make a huge impact on transportation emissions but will also make sure that there will be less material ending up on a landfill once the product has been delivered to the customer. Basically we're maximizing the amount of value that is being sent and minimizing any unnecessary packaging material that will be discarded upon arrival anyway.Sustainable materialsOur main plastics supplier is ISO 9001 certified and we've made sure that all of our injection molded plastics are utilized to 100%. Our suppliers have set up our production lines so that any failed parts, runners and waste are recycled back into the system and made into new parts for the Conda strap.Environmentally friendly factoriesIn order to keep transportation and emissions to a minimum we always aspire to keep our suppliers as close as possible. Our key suppliers are just a few kilometres away from our HQ and if we have goods that needs to be transported for longer distances we always opt for train over air when possible.Sustainable DistributionFor this campaign we've incorporated a new shipping strategy where the packages are sent in bulk from our HQ in Sweden to a distribution center in Germany. The Conda strap incorporates a lot of functions that enables the user to replace both the tripod and backpack and makes travelling easier and the luggage a lot lighter.

story:
Hi everybody! Thanks for checking out our product. It has been 5 months since we started designing this strap and finally, we have the perfect prototype. After countless hours of hard work, we are ready to put it in your hands. Now is the time when we need your help. Please, spread the word.

We are grateful for the opportunity to share our Leather Camera Strap with the Indiegogo community!

Do not hesitate and get yourself a camera strap you will love.


Why do I need the Leather Camera Strap?

  • Style is your life and fashion is your passion. Your look needs to be in perfect color harmony.
  • You want to have the coolest strap in your photographic community.
  • You want the best for your camera... ultimate quality natural materials and perfect functionality.
  • You love leather. 


About The Strap

Double Cross Leather Camera Strap is fully functional and adjustable. It features a durable non slip construction that uses all eco-friendly materials.

  • The comfortable neck strap with non-slip wool felt has a width of 4cm (1.6inch).
  • The strap assembly includes 4 metal screws with a diameter of 1,1cm (0.44inch). Every package includes black and nickel-colored metal screws, so that you can choose, which color you prefer. The package also includes a spare screw for each color and a small ring for fastening the screws – all you need for assembly and dis-assembly.
  • The length can be adjusted from 90cm – 128cm (35.4inch – 51.1inch) by shifting the inner straps in or out of the outer strap and fixing them by flat screws.

The strap fits most analog and digital cameras and can be attached both with or without the metal split rings. To use the strap without split rings, you can unscrew the mechanism that is holding the ring, remove the ring, attach the end-straps directly to the camera and re-assemble the ends with the screws. Always make sure that the screws are tightened well.

Using the flat screw system, the design doesn’t include any metal buckles that can cause discomfort or even camera scratching. This way, we use minimum metal parts and make the strap as simple and flat as possible.

  • The beauty of this product lies in well chosen quality materials. The oil-tanned leather offers superb durability, resistant to everyday wear and tear, while still being soft to the touch. The wool felt keeps the strap in place and minimize the risk of slipping from your shoulder.
  • Personalize your strap by choosing the color of leather, color of the felt and color of the top stitch on the outer neck strap. This gives you 80 possible color variations you can choose from. For more information, you can check out our Colorpicker at www.doublecrossleather.com.
  • The strap is handmade by skilled craftsmen in Slovakia (European Union) and proudly marked with our brand, which comes from the Slovak national symbol.


Adjusting lenght is easy:

Ring for fastening screws is included. You don't have to look for a screwdriver:


Choose Your Color Combination

That strap is nice, but what if my favorite color is blue? With Double Cross Leather, you can have the choice! Feel free to pick between 80 of unique color combinations. Choose pure elegance of classic natural look or stand out from the crowd using wilder color combinations that better suit your look.

Try our Color Picker

Colours to choose from:

Leather:

Felt:

Top stitch:

Can be either matching the color of the leather, or matching the color of felt.


Special for Indiegogo comunity

Special value early birds, will be manufactured and shipped first.
Brown-Grey Melange with top stitch matching brown leather
Brown-Lime with top stitch matching lime felt
Brown-Blood Orange with top stitch matching orange felt


Why Choose Us?

Here is a short list of things that make our product amazing:

  • Made with premium grade oil tanned leather, 100% wool felt and stitched with a durable thread.
  • Customization - Select your color combination.
  • 2-Year Guarantee. We will repair or replace any defects in materials or workmanship. 
  • Affordable. Premium leather straps of this quality can cost up to 150€.
  • Simple and flat profile. No buckles or other unreasonable metal parts.
  • Secure, tested extensively on multiple camera types
  • Fashionable 
  • Handmade by skilled craftsmen in Slovakia - European Union
  • Proudly marked with our company signature.
  • Made with LOVE :-)


Why We Went With Indiegogo?

  • We need yourhelp to start a proper business. 
  • You give us ideas to make the our strap better.
  • With your investment, we can arrange higher stocks of materials and arrange shorter delivery time.
  • Larger material orders reduce costs and make the final product price lower.
  • More orders mean lower price on shipping.


After Funding

Our team is ready to start creating your one of a kind Leather Camera Strap.  Our prices are discounted during our Indiegogo campaign!  Help us bring our work to you in the shortest delivery time possible by reaching our 3,450€ goal!  

We have a good start and are confident that this product will be successful. We already have the necessary machinery and team ready for the manufacture. 

Purchasing Materials - Everything is lined up to get started and we are ready to order materials as soon we receive funding (or even as soon as the campaign goal is successfully reached). Leather can be expensive, but if we reach our funding goal, we will be able to purchase large quantities at a lower cost. Same for Wool felt and other parts. This will help us being able to bring you a quality product for lower price.

E-Shop - Our goal is to make our future customers lives simple. With your funding, we can fund the development of our own e-commerce website. This will make it easier for you to choose, purchase, and receive our products. The basic template for our website is already launched here:  www.doublecrossleather.com.


Production Plan

Once the campaign is successfully funded, we will collect everyone’s requests about color combination. 

Then, we will use that information to start production of your rewards.  After completion, we will ship your new unique Leather Camera Strap directly to you!

Optimistic plan:

Before the successful finish of our campaign, we can take a short-term loan to order materials before receiving funds from Indiegogo to make everybody happy until the middle of May. We can make further preproduction steps, after we see the campaign succeed. This would make the delivery time even shorter.


Pessimistic plan:


About Shipping

After selecting a perk, you can add shipping to your contribution in the Additional Gift section. Please add custom Additional Gift according to following table:

EU Countries: 10€

USA: 15€

Rest of the World: 25€

Please be aware that for deliveries outside the EU, you may have to pay import fees on arrival.

We will ship products all over the world to destinations available by DHL. You can order with confidence, safe in the knowledge that we'll do our best to get your goods to you as quick as we can. It takes just a few days to deliver your order, wherever you are, however we don't like to guarantee exact delivery times due to unexpected delays that could occur with customs etc.


Share Us With the World!

Like and share us on Facebook and stay in touch

We are on Pinterest - Just pin something from our site for your friends

www.doublecrossleather.com

If you love our project, please be sure to share it! 

Thank you so much for all your support!


Risks and Challenges

The main risk of any project like this is delays in materials and than production. We have been making leather goods for some time and have learned the importance of sourcing, manufacturing, and fulfillment. We are confident though that there will be no hiccups or delays in the time frame provided.

Each step has been carefully planned and we have an experienced team to produce each strap with exceeding quality.

We pride ourselves in providing great customer service and promise to communicate frequently and openly with you. You can support this project and be confident, that your questions and feedback will be answered.

story:
We Need Equipment

Since 2014, we have been making films by renting basic and outdated equipment. We rent two cameras a day for 20,000 UGS. We rent a laptop/day for 20,000 UGS, and with this we must rent a month’s worth of electricity, called cash power here, at 50,000 UGS/month.

Individually, we have very little money. So to fund our films, we started to make bricks and build houses around camp, in addition to supporting ourselves and our families. We also sell our movies for 5,000 UGS to organizations and 3,000 UGS to Nakivale residents. After working hard for more than 3 months, saving 400,000 UGS, we finally have enough money to rent the equipment to make a film. However, this model comes with many obstacles. Often, the equipment does not work properly. If it rains, we cannot shoot and simply lose our money. We must finish the whole project in a month or we run out of electricity and have to pay for an additional month. The list goes on and on, but most importantly this model is not sustainable. We cannot grow our company.

I'm onboard already! So, What Exactly Is the Raised Money Going to Support?

Your donation will be put directly towards purchasing Nakivale Movies' own set of film equipment, which has been chosen with the help of film experts in the US and Kampala, the capital of Uganda. The nature of Kampala’s film equipment market hinders our ability to pinpoint specific models months in advance, but here’s our latest game plan: 

  • 4K/1080p HD Video Recording Camcorder $800-900
  • portable LED Light - $500
  • Electricity Generator - $600
  • Protective gear (bags and cases) - $200
  • Lavalier mics with Zoom audio - $500-600
  • Equipment Manager Stipend - $60
  • Transportation to and from Kampala - $30

Wait a Second, How Are Movies Going to Help Refugees?

Trek down to Nakivale in Southwest Uganda, and you will immediately find our population is overcrowded. We see the same thing, but when you live here for 9 years a new image unfolds: We see ambitious people in the face of monstrous struggle, a camp overcrowded with talent and assets, waiting to be tapped into by a project like ours. This campaign is about what a struggling community can accomplish autonomously, armed with a just a camera and a sincere belief in the innate potential and creativity that overcrowds Nakivale.

This is not some film theory that we are hoping to test out. We’ve done this before, and these films were successful, money making, job creating, hope generating, magical endeavors. We have tackled and documented Nakivale-specific issues such as alcoholism, poverty, rights of refugees, educational opportunities, peace and ethnic tension. We did it by transforming our farmers into actors and doctors into directors, and we need you to help keep the magic alive.

Who Are The Geniuses and Activists Behind This Whole Thing?

Over 40 refugees collaborated to create each of our previous two feature films, but check out Nakivale Movies' executive team.

And here are some friends of Nakivale Movies who have made this Indiegogo possible:

Indiegogo Equipment Manager - Godfrey Gamole, responsible for transferring the donations to Nakivale Movies, and photographing receipts and equipment.

Kampala Film Expert -Walter Mukoza , will assist Alex Bucunga and Godfrey Gamole to scout out Kampala's highest quality film equipment at the best value.

Student Liaisons -Sam Morrison, Brendan Hall, and Anthony Blake, helped to write this Indiegogo, and create the campaign video.

...I Just Don’t Have Money Right Now.

We get it. But we won’t let money stop this collaboration, right? We sincerely believe in the power of a simple Facebook share and a one-liner about the awesomeness of Nakivale Movies. Tell your parents. Tell your grandparents. Tell your dog. Get the word out! 

Contact Us

We encourage you to scrutinize all development projects, not just ours! So please, if you have concerns, questions, suggestions, hesitancy sharing this project for any reason, message us. You can contact Nakivale Movies directly at nakivalemovies@gmail.com, but a lack of access to wifi at Nakivale may delay the response more than you're used to. For a quick response, send a message to Sam Morrison at shm89@cornell.edu.

We rent a laptop/day for 20,000 UGS, and with this we must rent a month’s worth of electricity, called cash power here, at 50,000 UGS/month.Individually, we have very little money. So to fund our films, we started to make bricks and build houses around camp, in addition to supporting ourselves and our families. We also sell our movies for 5,000 UGS to organizations and 3,000 UGS to Nakivale residents. After working hard for more than 3 months, saving 400,000 UGS, we finally have enough money to rent the equipment to make a film. However, this model comes with many obstacles. Often, the equipment does not work properly. If it rains, we cannot shoot and simply lose our money. We must finish the whole project in a month or we run out of electricity and have to pay for an additional month. The list goes on and on, but most importantly this model is not sustainable. We cannot grow our company.I'm onboard already! So, What Exactly Is the Raised Money Going to Support?Your donation will be put directly towards purchasing Nakivale Movies' own set of film equipment, which has been chosen with the help of film experts in the US and Kampala, the capital of Uganda. The nature of Kampala’s film equipment market hinders our ability to pinpoint specific models months in advance, but here’s our latest game plan: 
4K/1080p HD Video Recording Camcorder $800-900
portable LED Light - $500
Electricity Generator - $600
Protective gear (bags and cases) - $200
Lavalier mics with Zoom audio - $500-600
Equipment Manager Stipend - $60
Transportation to and from Kampala - $30
Wait a Second, How Are Movies Going to Help Refugees?Trek down to Nakivale in Southwest Uganda, and you will immediately find our population is overcrowded. We see the same thing, but when you live here for 9 years a new image unfolds: We see ambitious people in the face of monstrous struggle, a camp overcrowded with talent and assets, waiting to be tapped into by a project like ours. This campaign is about what a struggling community can accomplish autonomously, armed with a just a camera and a sincere belief in the innate potential and creativity that overcrowds Nakivale.This is not some film theory that we are hoping to test out. We’ve done this before, and these films were successful, money making, job creating, hope generating, magical endeavors. We have tackled and documented Nakivale-specific issues such as alcoholism, poverty, rights of refugees, educational opportunities, peace and ethnic tension. We did it by transforming our farmers into actors and doctors into directors, and we need you to help keep the magic alive.Who Are The Geniuses and Activists Behind This Whole Thing?Over 40 refugees collaborated to create each of our previous two feature films, but check out Nakivale Movies' executive team.And here are some friends of Nakivale Movies who have made this Indiegogo possible:Indiegogo Equipment Manager - Godfrey Gamole, responsible for transferring the donations to Nakivale Movies, and photographing receipts and equipment.Kampala Film Expert -Walter Mukoza , will assist Alex Bucunga and Godfrey Gamole to scout out Kampala's highest quality film equipment at the best value.Student Liaisons -Sam Morrison, Brendan Hall, and Anthony Blake, helped to write this Indiegogo, and create the campaign video....I Just Don’t Have Money Right Now.We get it. But we won’t let money stop this collaboration, right? We sincerely believe in the power of a simple Facebook share and a one-liner about the awesomeness of Nakivale Movies. Tell your parents. Tell your grandparents. Tell your dog. Get the word out! Contact UsWe encourage you to scrutinize all development projects, not just ours! So please, if you have concerns, questions, suggestions, hesitancy sharing this project for any reason, message us. You can contact Nakivale Movies directly at nakivalemovies@gmail.com, but a lack of access to wifi at Nakivale may delay the response more than you're used to. For a quick response, send a message to Sam Morrison at shm89@cornell.edu.

story:
Dead Silent

Sixteen-Year-old Aaron is forced to comes to terms with watching the world around him fall apart, when blood is mixed with tragedy, and your home becomes infested by the dead, surviving a zombie outbreak isn’t easy on your own, especially when you’re a deaf mute.

About the film

Hi my name is Lewis Clements, I am the writer and producer for 'Dead Silent' and I am currently studying Creative Media Production in the West Midlands. I have been a passionate fan of the zombie genre ever since I was a young boy, when I first saw George Romero's 1978 'Dawn of the Dead', but it has taken some creative juices to come up with an original idea in such a crowded genre. 

I believe that 'Dead Silent' is a complete fresh concept, the idea that a boy with a disability whom has the world on his shoulders, but still manage's to show as much courage and spirit as any other human being would; equality is the main objective here. It's a fun idea that is ambitious in scope, yet contained in terms of location, making it achievable on a low budget.

To achieve success this film needs convincing make-up, good costumes and good set dressing. There are no shadows in which to hide the zombies, if the make up or gore effects are cheap, the film will fail in its ambition to be the best zombie short.

This Film means so much to me, it is something I have always loved and I have the chance to really make an impression and make a name for us. Any assistance in this would be hugely appreciated to help us reach this goal.

How our budget is spent

There has been a lot of planning put into making our budget work, we are aware that it is a small budget and we wanted to produce a short film on a tight scale to prove it can be done. our budget will be spent on the following:

Location Fee's - Getting the right location is crucial to us, although based in a residential area it is key to focus on getting the right feel for our film which the house will have a good control over. Alongside the actual location we will have to get props which will be a minimal addition to the location budget spend.

Zombie Prosthetic Effects - Our film is dependant on our characters looking right, our zombies have to be real and this is an area we cant cheap out on. 

Professional Crew members - This is a professional short film, we are giving students and amateurs the opportunity to work alongside industry professionals on our set giving experience to all. We understand how hard it can be for passionate individuals lacking experience to break out and we hope that our short film can facilitate their skills.

They will be the biggest 3 focuses of our budget, additions on the left over budget will include travel and food for all our staff over the 3 production days.

The Crew

Lewis Clements: Writer, Producer.

Lewis is currently studying a degree in Creative Media Production, he has been involved with several professional filming crews working as a camera operator and as an assistant producer; he has also worked with reputable clients such as EGX and has spent time filming local events as well editing corporate videos. He is also a camera operator for BT Sport and films professional football football matches  to be then be aired live on tv. Filming is his passion though, and he is working on a number of short and feature ideas in his spare time.

Zak East: Cinematography

Zak East has been a fan of Sci Fi and Fantasy his whole life, armed with his Panasonic Lumix Gh4  he is our cinematographer trusted with operating and instructing our cameras. At the age of 22 he has had various amounts of experience working as a technician, camera operator and production sound mixer on many different sets. He has nothing but passion for our short film.

Daniel Charlton: Director

Daniel is one of the youngest members of the team at only 19 but has the most drive to make this short film work. As a rising star he has studied media for 6 years academically already with a head of steam he is in his second year to getting his degree. He has worked as a director on several amateur projects before and lead a crew filming thousands of visitors at EGX 2016, he is confident in his own skills and so are we.

Cast

Tom Inglis - Aaron

Birmingham Based Tom Inglis will play the crucial lead role. Tom will play deaf mute Aaron and test his survival instincts in a zombie outbreak! 

Tom is 18 and currently studying performing arts, he has been part of several amateur theater shows; one of which being an original show and a short film that himself and several others helped create a story for. He has also been working for a horror attraction company called Twisted Attraction for 3 years

Hopes 

This film has at its heart an original idea that will make it stand out from most films in the crowded zombie and horror genres and I hope that it will generate a buzz at festivals and conventions around the world. 

To pull that off will require the funds to make the film look as grand as the central premise. The more we raise, the better this film will look and the more detailed we can make the world around our disabled young man as he attempts to survive.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel you do not wish or cannot contribute financially, please support the film in any way you can and by sharing this page to Facebook and Twitter. Also please follow us on Twitter, share our posts, like our Facebook page and spread the word about this campaign to help us achieve our goal. 

There are numerous ways to engage with us: 

https://twitter.com/GoldenPineProd

https://www.facebook.com/GoldenPineProductions/

story:
Shooter's Aid Elite an android mobile app tool for ISSF Sport Shooters and Athletes, is simple, yet featured-packed that serves as a personal trainer at the same time a unique logging and documentation application that will give benefit to any level shooters.

We had newly released an initial version on googleplay store: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.hansens.shootersaidelite

It had been welcomed positively so far. We had been working hard to implement more enhancements and ideas into the released version with goals to give more benefits to every shooter, from beginners, athletes, shooting clubs and even coaches!

CAMERA SCANNING CAPABILITY/FEATURE will be implemented.

This feature will allow users to take an image of the paper targets in 5 shots program. Using the app, it will activate the mobile camera which takes the photo. The app automatically scans and analyzes the HIT HOLES, and then translates the them into DECIMAL SCORE POINTS, which will automatically be input in the provided interface score sheets.

What We Need to DO

  • Continuation of the development of CAMERA SCANNING CAPABILITY and USER INTERFACE
  • ENHANCEMENTS of PDF Capability
  • EHNANCEMENTS of User Interface for 10m Air Pistol, 10m Air Rifle, 50m Rifle Prone and 50m Rifle 3 Pos.
  • ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS
  • We will be integrating NRA, Bulleseye Targets aside from the European Targets within ISSF Standards.

The Impact of CAMERA SCANNING CAPABILITY/FEATURE

  • Having in mind the fact that most athletes and sport shooters trained on paper targets and compete on electronic targets, the CAMERA SCANNING CAPABILITY will be a  very important addition to their trainings. Combined with all the app's initial features plus this capability, it will be complete personal training for all athletes competing on ISSF disciplines.

Challenges

We as a team is qualified to overcome challenges that we may be facing in this process. With success and goal in mind, we can overcome hurdles.

Unfortunately, all developments have cost, we are handling most part of this challenge, however we are asking the shooting community to unite with us in this project for the benefit of everyone!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you can not contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • SHARE our CAMPAIGN to your Social medias
  • WORD of MOUTH is one of the best method to spread the news.
HELP US ACHIEVE THIS GOAL FOR THE BENEFIT OF ALL ISSF ATHLETES, SPORT SHOOTERS and for the LOVE OF THE SPORT!

story:
Agnieszka, 2014 & Pietà (Maria and Marguerite), 2015. © Julia Kulon

WHO ARE YOU?

My name is Julia Kulon, I am currently a senior at St. John’s College majoring in philosophy.

I first picked up a camera when I was twelve years old. Before that, I had been infatuated with creating little digital collages on Photoshop and dabbling in graphic design. I mostly taught myself skills by watching videos and reading manuals on the internet—mostly I would open Photoshop and click around, manipulating text and images as I pleased until I reached my desired effect. There came a point in my life where I was increasingly frustrated with relying on content that I found from the internet that the next logical step was to create my own. I received a Canon Rebel XS for Christmas and began to take pictures.

The presence of the camera began to transcend all my boundaries in life. A sharp but increasingly growing hesitant young woman bogged down in hospitalizations and her own insecurities, the medium of photography registered to me as a language that I was comfortable using to maneuver the world. Having a camera allowed me to be a spectator and to participate in my surroundings even when I was too shy and hesitant. It became my suit of armor, my protector. Slowly I was able to start communicating and expressing myself more fully as an individual because I recognized that what I saw in the lens was valuable and a reflection of myself. What I saw in the viewfinder I liked, so I began to want to share it with people who would become my friends. 

Marguerite, 2015.  © Julia Kulon

I never really fully consciously considered the camera’s influence on my life until I shot a wedding last year where the bride had a younger brother who was also incredibly shy and faced with his own disability. The bride pulled me aside before the wedding and asked if I could cast aside my ‘no other camera’ rule. She told me:

“The camera allows him to communicate with the world. This is the lens that allows him to bridge the gap between himself and the people around him.”

As I looked at him, I was overcome with a feeling of understanding and kinship to this man that I barely knew and at the same time knew all too well. This is what photography has been for me a “lens that allows [one] to bridge the gap between [oneself] and the people around [oneself].” 

Lola, 2015.  © Julia Kulon

Over the course of the last two years, I have been incredibly lucky to be surrounded by friends and family who would push me every time I faltered in my own self-confidence when it came to creating images of the beauty that I saw. 

With their help, I finally came to persuading myself to try a hand at portrait photography, having mostly photographed nature and architecture.

Now for anyone who knows a thing about portrait photography, they know it’s incredibly hard.  You have to develop a relationship with your subject in order to cultivate a feeling of comfort and intimacy. By all accounts, it is a reciprocal relationship. If it isn’t, the photographs are rarely successful. They lack vitality and honesty.

 Although very scary, somewhere in that place of comfort a lot of magic happens. I am still learning the ropes of this process which has allowed me to become more assertive with my voice and my vision, and moreover the process has taught me so much about connection—what it truly means for a human being to be a human being with another human being. That statement is one that I’m still trying to figure out. At the moment, I am extremely motivated and captivated by attempting to capture people’s inner beauty in a externally geared medium. Substance over form. How do we capture that visually?

Lola, 2015. © Julia Kulon

WHAT KIND OF INVESTMENTS HAVE YOU MADE?

Over the last year and a half, I have made a conscious effort to invest in my love for photography. After having a tearful goodbye with my beloved Canon Rebel XS that I have passed on to a dear friend of mine in hopes that the camera will continue to live on and bring inspiration and magic to her life, I bought a Canon EOS 7D Mark II Digital SLR Camera after working all summer at a product innovation firm. 

I have also invested in an external hard drive, a state of the art quick-performing card driver, an Instax Polaroid Camera to begin pre-session documentation and purchased an Adobe Photography membership which I pay for every month. 

I have been fortunate enough to be graced by true gifts. One family friend surprised with the beautiful gift, a Canon EF Lens 50 mm f/1.8 (all images pictured here shot on this lens). He warned me that the lens was a real hassle when it came to focusing, and he was ultimately right. For the first year, the lens was my pride and joy. The more I began to shoot, however, the more disgruntled I became with the lens and its limitations. I wanted more, and this time it made down to the restrictions of the equipment itself rather than my vision but a finicky lens became a true hinderance to my vision. Last Christmas, I was  fortunate enough to receive a Velbron DF 60, a lightweight, aluminum tripod, ideal for someone who is physically unable to lift extremely heavy things or carry them for a long time.

To the best of my ability, I have tried to provide myself with getting better equipment while being fortunate to have had many pleasant surprises come my way.

Marriage and Civil Court, Chicago, IL, 2015.

WHAT NOW?

I am asking for money for a new lens, particularly a Canon EF 35mm f/1.4L II USM AutoFocus Wide Angle Lens. I hope it will become my prime lens to shoot with and that it will stick around with me for a very, very long time.

I am currently a student and I do not have the financial means to make this purchase myself. I work an on-campus job as the College’s darkroom manager and technician where I hope to guide and inspire other people’s journeys and beginning forays into black and white photography. While this has been such a rewarding experience, it simply does not offer any financial support other than support for essential necessities. 

Additionally, my handicap does pose some problems in this department. I am not able to stand for longer than ten to fifteen minutes without having my feet hurt and being fatigued. Having club feet, I am not able to stand fully on the balls of my feet so a lot of my body weight is supported by my toes as opposed to every part of my foot. This causes discomfort and directly correlates to lacking great bipedal locomotion that one would normally have. An average human being who has been standing for a long time has the ability to take that energy and recreate it into more kinetic energy—I do not. Diagnosed with curvature of the joints, my wrists are not able to hold flat things, e.g. dishes or serving plates for a long time. I find it extremely difficult to grasp anything that should be fundamentally perpendicular to my wrist bone. 

These challenges have rendered me physically unable to to take the traditional routes of working in customer service or food industry, otherwise I would have utilized that route a long time ago.

I have made investments to this passion of mine to the best extent that my life has allowed for me, but in order to take the next step in my journey, I’m ready to take on the next level in my own photographic journey, and for that I need your help.

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

Your contributions will go to buying Canon EF 35mm f/1.4L II USM AutoFocus Wide Angle Lens; one year insurance is included in this price ($1,800) with additional tax and shipping costs. Moreover, some money has been allotted for the printing of photographic prints, shipping and packaging costs as well as Indiegogo's 5% fee.

Any additional money that may be raised through this endeavor will go to a saving account and will be used to purchase more equipment in the future. I am planning in the future to create a website or possibly purchasing proper lighting equipment. 

WHAT ARE THE INITIATIVES?

(The following initiatives are valued at the assumption that not all packages or prints will be bought.)

One will be providing photographic services for whatever needs are desired. This may be portraiture for your children, significant other, you yourself—anything that you would like to have proper documentation made of or would like to make an occasion out of.

For sponsors located in Warsaw, Poland, I will be in Warsaw from December 18, 2015 to January 11, 2016 tentatively.

For sponsors located in Chicago, Illinois, I will be in Chicago March 2016.

I am currently primarily located in Annapolis, Maryland. Such inquiries will be planned accordingly.

Packages include:

  • For donations of $150, you will receive two hours of shooting time and 10-15 edited images. (7 Packages)
  • For donations of $200, you will receive two to three hours of shooting time and 25-30 edited images. (7 Packages)
  • For donations of $300, you will receive three hours of shooting time and edited 30-40 images. (3 Packages)

Similarly, donations may also come in form of receiving fine photographic prints. I am offering prints of 5 images.

  • For $10, you will receive a postcard sized photograph (5" x 7”) 
  • For $15, you will receive a standard letter sized photograph (8.5” by 11”) 
  • For $20, you will receive a standard poster sized photograph (11″ x 17″) 
Photographs include:

1. Untitled I, 2015 (from Flora series)
2. Untitled II, 2015 (from Flora series)

3. Untitled III, 2015 (from Flora series)

4. Untitled IV, 2015 (from The Sailboat)

5. For The Masses (Chicago From The River)

 All prints will be delivered in white manila envelopes with a sturdy cardboard casing to ensure that the prints will not be bent in the process of their being mailed.

Other donations of different values or similar (without the request of print or package) will be given a thank you email and will be included on the list of sponsors when I issue a thank you statement on my blog for all those who have made this dream possible.

Thank you for reading, and as always, thank you for your support in my endeavors. I can't express how much I appreciate it.

Much love and light,

Julia Kulon

I have also invested in an external hard drive, a state of the art quick-performing card driver, an Instax Polaroid Camera to begin pre-session documentation and purchased an Adobe Photography membership which I pay for every month. 


I have been fortunate enough to be graced by true gifts. One family friend surprised with the beautiful gift, a Canon EF Lens 50 mm f/1.8 (all images pictured here shot on this lens). He warned me that the lens was a real hassle when it came to focusing, and he was ultimately right. For the first year, the lens was my pride and joy. The more I began to shoot, however, the more disgruntled I became with the lens and its limitations. I wanted more, and this time it made down to the restrictions of the equipment itself rather than my vision but a finicky lens became a true hinderance to my vision. Last Christmas, I was  fortunate enough to receive a Velbron DF 60, a lightweight, aluminum tripod, ideal for someone who is physically unable to lift extremely heavy things or carry them for a long time.


To the best of my ability, I have tried to provide myself with getting better equipment while being fortunate to have had many pleasant surprises come my way.



Marriage and Civil Court, Chicago, IL, 2015.WHAT NOW?I am asking for money for a new lens, particularly a Canon EF 35mm f/1.4L II USM AutoFocus Wide Angle Lens. I hope it will become my prime lens to shoot with and that it will stick around with me for a very, very long time.

I am currently a student and I do not have the financial means to make this purchase myself. I work an on-campus job as the College’s darkroom manager and technician where I hope to guide and inspire other people’s journeys and beginning forays into black and white photography. While this has been such a rewarding experience, it simply does not offer any financial support other than support for essential necessities. 

Additionally, my handicap does pose some problems in this department. I am not able to stand for longer than ten to fifteen minutes without having my feet hurt and being fatigued. Having club feet, I am not able to stand fully on the balls of my feet so a lot of my body weight is supported by my toes as opposed to every part of my foot. This causes discomfort and directly correlates to lacking great bipedal locomotion that one would normally have. An average human being who has been standing for a long time has the ability to take that energy and recreate it into more kinetic energy—I do not. Diagnosed with curvature of the joints, my wrists are not able to hold flat things, e.g. dishes or serving plates for a long time. I find it extremely difficult to grasp anything that should be fundamentally perpendicular to my wrist bone. 

These challenges have rendered me physically unable to to take the traditional routes of working in customer service or food industry, otherwise I would have utilized that route a long time ago.

I have made investments to this passion of mine to the best extent that my life has allowed for me, but in order to take the next step in my journey, I’m ready to take on the next level in my own photographic journey, and for that I need your help.WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?
Your contributions will go to buying Canon EF 35mm f/1.4L II USM AutoFocus Wide Angle Lens; one year insurance is included in this price ($1,800) with additional tax and shipping costs. Moreover, some money has been allotted for the printing of photographic prints, shipping and packaging costs as well as Indiegogo's 5% fee.

Any additional money that may be raised through this endeavor will go to a saving account and will be used to purchase more equipment in the future. I am planning in the future to create a website or possibly purchasing proper lighting equipment. WHAT ARE THE INITIATIVES?
(The following initiatives are valued at the assumption that not all packages or prints will be bought.)


One will be providing photographic services for whatever needs are desired. This may be portraiture for your children, significant other, you yourself—anything that you would like to have proper documentation made of or would like to make an occasion out of.


For sponsors located in Warsaw, Poland, I will be in Warsaw from December 18, 2015 to January 11, 2016 tentatively.


For sponsors located in Chicago, Illinois, I will be in Chicago March 2016.


I am currently primarily located in Annapolis, Maryland. Such inquiries will be planned accordingly.


Packages include:





For donations of $150, you will receive two hours of shooting time and 10-15 edited images. (7 Packages)


For donations of $200, you will receive two to three hours of shooting time and 25-30 edited images. (7 Packages)


For donations of $300, you will receive three hours of shooting time and edited 30-40 images. (3 Packages)




Similarly, donations may also come in form of receiving fine photographic prints. I am offering prints of 5 images.





For $10, you will receive a postcard sized photograph (5" x 7”) 


For $15, you will receive a standard letter sized photograph (8.5” by 11”) 


For $20, you will receive a standard poster sized photograph (11″ x 17″) 


Photographs include:









1. Untitled I, 2015 (from Flora series)

2. Untitled II, 2015 (from Flora series)


3. Untitled III, 2015 (from Flora series)


4. Untitled IV, 2015 (from The Sailboat)


5. For The Masses (Chicago From The River)
 All prints will be delivered in white manila envelopes with a sturdy cardboard casing to ensure that the prints will not be bent in the process of their being mailed.


Other donations of different values or similar (without the request of print or package) will be given a thank you email and will be included on the list of sponsors when I issue a thank you statement on my blog for all those who have made this dream possible.


Thank you for reading, and as always, thank you for your support in my endeavors. I can't express how much I appreciate it.


Much love and light,
Julia Kulon

story:
Almost every Photographer wants to be able to show their best image / video on a high resolution large screen, Viewing scene from the camera's small screen is inconvenient and hard to see the details. Currently there are 2 ways to achieve a better review from the camera, both have their pros & cons:

1) Field monitor : too bulky 

2) App control : works only with certain models of camera, rely on wi-fi connection, has lags. 

We believe there must be a better solution for this, so we designed HD900, the first tablet in the market with HDMI input, provide the fastest way to check your work immediately. Right after you connect the camera and HD900 with HDMI cable, your work will display in our 9" , 2560*1600 high resolution anti-glare screen.

Review your pictures / videos is much easier now, without sacrifice the image quality, or adding extra weight in your backpack.













                  HD900 is perfect display for PS, XBOX,Zotac zbox, Rasberry PI etc.











Shenzhen G-vision technology Co., Ltd, brand owner of the “Flysight”, is a high-tech enterprise in Shenzhen. We focus on high-end video & audio products for more than 8 years. Our solid quality gain us great reputation among customers all over the world. With CE & FCC certification, we keep pursuit high quality and advanced technology, offer best product to our customers

During the last few years, we keep hearing from our customers “complain” about how their bag gets heavier with their photograph skill gets better. Tripod, lens, extra battery etc, they are adding more and more items to their must-carry list.

Field monitor is good, in fact, we are proud of the monitor we produced, and our customers love it. But carry it with all the gears can be very inconvenient. It is also a time consuming task to organize your bag with so many cables inside. 

That’s why we design HD900, A combination of tablet and field monitor. To help you carry less, spend less time on chores, and focus on what you really good at, photography.

Producing a tablet is costly, all the molding fee, imported components, authorization fee, certification fee etc, they are expensive. Unlike the big brands in the market, we don’t have big budget to waste. Which means we need to get every detail right, by the user’s standard.

So here we are, at indiegogo, by crowdfunding this project, we are able to get closer with you, listen to you, work with you, develop the product with you, and finally, delivery it to your hand.

story:
中文網頁 | 中文贊助教學

Mercu, compact size and buttonless design, is an unprecedented smart home device. That integrates a surveillance camera, environment detector, alarm siren, SD card storage, and many more useful functions. Allowing you to easily control, monitor and secure your home from your cellphone using a convenient APP.

Using the convenient cellphone APP allows you to control various aspects of your home environment.

The World's Smallest Smarthome Gateway Camera

In the compact device, apart from Full HD (1080P) High Definition Camera, multiple sources for wireless technologies (WiFi/BLE/Zigbee), humidity meter, luminance meter, it also includes built-in color ring LED signal indicator which can instantly monitor your home security. With built-in loudspeaker, it contains an alarm siren and also plays user recorded voice prompts.

Built-in color ring LED signal indicator instantly monitors your home security.

  

 

High scalability allowing fast and easy expansion

Mercu is the most expandable smart home device. Apart from several built-in detectors, it enables wireless connections with Zigbee, Wifi or BLE and integrates at least more than ten (various) detectors and smart plugs. You can easily customize your own inexpensive DIY smart home security system and tailor it to meet your individual needs.

 

Multiple functions

 

Wondering how you can effortlessly make your home connected with Mercu? It’s only 3 steps as follow:

Easy to share your Room and Event

You can log in with Facebook or a Google account, to instantly share monitor images, event notifications, and keep family members up to date about your current situation.

 

Using simple drag-and- drop operations, you can easily set up alarm conditions and monitor all the rooms in your house. It gives you the ability to easily monitor and control your home from the convenience of your smartphone or tablet while giving you peace of mind.

 

Event Playback 

You can use the APP to search for past events and instantly play them back allowing you to quickly evaluate the current status of your home.

 

 

Local storage and cloud backup

As well as the Built-in SD card slot, dropbox will also sync a copy of all your files in cloud storage. Ensuring your files will never be lost. If your SD card is damaged, by simply replacing a new card, you can access your cloud storage and restore the lost data. If by any chance you lose internet connectivity, data will be saved on the local SD card first and once the connection is back, a copy of all your data will automatically be synced to your cloud storage.

 

Voice Memo

When an intruder is detected, an alarm sound will be triggered to scare the intruder away. Mercu can also be programmed to play pre-recorded voice messages such as welcome messages and has a programmable alarm function to remind you of important events.

Alarm Sound

Alarm Test Live Video

Night Vision 

Even in complete darkness, using the built-in wide angle infrared illuminator, clear images are captured.

 

 

Easy installation: Built-in magnets in the Mercu device and the base, allow effortless adjustment of the viewing angle of your camera and installation anywhere.

The device can be easily moved both horizontally and vertically. Allowing convenient user installation.

 

 

Inside Out

Mercu evolution

 

In The Box

 

 

GalaThings is a very innovative and dedicated team of individuals that have more than 10 years of experience in the security and monitoring sector. Every member of the team is devoted to home security and IoT, providing modern solutions to all aspects of home security from software to hardware development.

The core concept of Gala Things is not only to produce high quality technological products but to make them user friendly. Mercu is our first product that we proudly offer to you.

 

Q. Why do I need Mercu since I already have a IP camera?

Mercu is not only a complete fully functional IP camera, but also a smart home gateway. It has a built-in thermal and humidity sensor and wireless connections with WiFi / BLE / Zigbee. You can also expand more wireless sensors and controllers with the APP to build your own smart home.

Q. How do we supply power to Mercu? Do we have a built-in battery?

We don’t have a built-in battery. You need to use the power adapter provided with Mercu to operate the device.

Q. Does it require complex setup to start using Mercu?

After setting up Mercu, all you need to do is download the APP. Plug in the power adapter with the device, the APP will connect with the device via Bluetooth. Insert your wifi password and complete the setting. It’s very simple.

Q. Can I install Mercu outdoors?

Mercu is not waterproof. If you can protect the device from the rain and exposure to direct sunlight, you can install the device outdoors.

Q. Can I use several Mercu devices at the same time?

Yes. You can use the APP to monitor several Meru devices and control them. You can also use the event function to set up and use it as a sequential controller to control several Mercu devices at the same time.

Q. What devices can I control with Mercu?

So far, via Zigbee, Mercu can control open close sensor, smoke dectors, shock detector, smart plug and PIR sensor. In the future, we will integrate Philips Hue and Belkin WeMo light switches. 

Q: Is it possible to operate Mercu with several cellphones at the same time?

Yes. In addition, you can share an account number among several cellphones. People who share the same account are allowed to view images simultaneously.

Q. How do I use cloud storage? Do I need to pay extra for it?

Input your dropbox storage account and you can use backup and recovery functions for free.

Q: How long is the warranty period of Mercu?

We cover your Mercu under a Limited Warranty for one year. If you have any further questions, please feel free to send an email to support@galathings.com . We will help you as soon as possible.

Q. How about worldwide shipping policy and relevant charges?

Mercu is available for international shipping. Shipping costs vary depending on the destination. Import tax and VAT are not included. To make sure Mercu can reach you safe and sound, please leave your phone number with your address.
